commit_message:
Libvirt: gracefully handle non-nic VFs

As part of adding support for bandwidth based scheduling
I038867c4094d79ae4a20615ab9c9f9e38fcc2e0a introduced
automatic discovery of parent netdev names for PCIe
virtual functions.

Nova's PCI passthrough support was originally developed for
Intel QAT devices and other generic PCI devices. Later support
for Neutron based SR-IOV NIC was added.

The PCI-SIG SR-IOV specification while most often used by NIC
vendors to virtualise a NIC in hardware was designed for devices
of any PCIe class. Support for Intel's QAT device and other
accelerators like AMD's SRIOV based vGPU have therefore been
regressed by the introduction of the new parent_ifname lookup code.

This change simply catches the exception that would be raised
when pci_utils.get_ifname_by_pci_address is called on generic
VFs allowing a graceful fallback to the previous behaviour.

Change-Id: Ib3811f828246311d90b0e3ba71c162c03fb8fe5a
Closes-Bug: #1821938

subject: DNM: Re-add skipsdist=True, except for lower-constraints
messages:
[{'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-04-04 19:53:20.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-04-04 20:19:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Bug 1823251 is for tracking this btw, but it's hitting on more than just nova since 4/1 so I'm not sure this is the culprit, it could be something more global like a new package getting release in bionic nodes on 4/1."}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-04-04 20:39:06.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2019-04-04 21:13:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

The superfluous bit was identified by stephenfin in the review of [1], and I checked with the tox docs to try to confirm it and it seemed to be right.

If we're using usedevelop = True then skipsdist is supposed to be defaulted https://tox.readthedocs.io/en/latest/example/general.html#avoiding-expensive-sdist

However, what tox gets up to is often different from what tox thinks it gets up to.

But, even if it is doing something odd, we need some kind of working theory on why sdist would or would not make any difference, and nothing comes to mind."}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2019-04-04 21:15:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

commit_message:
DNM: Re-add skipsdist=True, except for lower-constraints

This was removed as part of [1], as being "superfluous"

We've started seeing zuul failures since that patch; so for now we're
just putting it back in to see if those clear up.

[1] Ic6466b0440a4fe012731a63715cf5d793b6ae4dd

Change-Id: I067057e4927c315142240772c8e58236e488c7b6

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-03-29 09:12:16.000000000', 'message': 'Set a fixed cipher suite set for Traefik

Explicitly set the support cipher suite for Ingress TLS using Traefik,
following Mozilla intermediate minus DES3:
https://wiki.mozilla.org/Security/Server_Side_TLS#Intermediate_compatibility_.28default.29

Move the Traefik configuration to a ConfigMap for more flexbility than
provided by command line arguments.

Change-Id: I5a5a95385c4143cce21c60073ae168336c4b2f27
Story: 2005326
Task: 30254
'}]
commit_message:
Set a fixed cipher suite set for Traefik

Explicitly set the support cipher suite for Ingress TLS using Traefik,
following Mozilla intermediate minus DES3:
https://wiki.mozilla.org/Security/Server_Side_TLS#Intermediate_compatibility_.28default.29

Move the Traefik configuration to a ConfigMap for more flexbility than
provided by command line arguments.

Change-Id: I5a5a95385c4143cce21c60073ae168336c4b2f27
Story: 2005326
Task: 30254

commit_message:
[api-ref] De-duplicate date and time parameters

Many APIs present information when the resource
in question was 'created_at' and 'updated_at'.

Having common parameters is easier to maintain in
the documentation since the description is the same
across the board.

Change-Id: Ia5d4ac399fe0d7983c61f5c5e0245d0987e97d6a
Partial-Bug: #1760644

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-04-04 14:22:23.000000000', 'message': "Add docs on what not to include in notifications

Based on bug 1823104 it's clear we should have some
explicit wording in the notification reference docs
about what not to include in versioned notification
payloads, so this change attempts to start that with
the most obvious thing - don't expose access credentials
to the nova deployment.

This also adds a reminder to think about what is being
added / mirrored from internal objects and determine if
consumers really need it and if they aren't asking, opt
to not including it until requested.

Change-Id: I326aa39d963091282a5d0b70ba222abfe8ccfdac
Related-Bug: #1823104
"}]
commit_message:
Add docs on what not to include in notifications

Based on bug 1823104 it's clear we should have some
explicit wording in the notification reference docs
about what not to include in versioned notification
payloads, so this change attempts to start that with
the most obvious thing - don't expose access credentials
to the nova deployment.

This also adds a reminder to think about what is being
added / mirrored from internal objects and determine if
consumers really need it and if they aren't asking, opt
to not including it until requested.

Change-Id: I326aa39d963091282a5d0b70ba222abfe8ccfdac
Related-Bug: #1823104

commit_message:
Make compatible with Django 1.10 and 1.11

Removes use of future tag (not available in Django 1.10+).
Flatten Context into dict for render (necessary for Django 1.11+).

Both changes compatible with Django >= 1.8.

Change-Id: I5db4af45208423753dd5d60616ee781e6471b9e6
Closes-bug: 1816707

commit_message:
Make compatible with Django 1.10 and 1.11

Removes use of future tag (not available in Django 1.10+).
Flatten Context into dict for render (necessary for Django 1.11+).

Both changes compatible with Django >= 1.8.

Change-Id: I5db4af45208423753dd5d60616ee781e6471b9e6
Closes-bug: 1816707

commit_message:
Retire linaro-cn1

The SSL cert for the API has expired, so we haven't been talking to
this cloud for some time.  We have been requested to decommission it
[1]; so remove from nodepool config.

Story: #2005353
Task: #30335

[1] http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/irclogs/%23openstack-infra/%23openstack-infra.2019-04-03.log.html#t2019-04-03T22:16:31

Change-Id: I149e74ff5e788bb860deb4c3cc38d9c8ed5766c6

commit_message:
Test _alternate_id logic

This unit test shows an underlying issue that was causing some key_manager
service methods to fail. The issue has since been fixed, as the test
passes now. But let's add the test.

Change-Id: I3e9e737064a167694a176cc3afb20bb5bcc59f98
Related-Bug: #1628957

[{'created': '2019-04-01 20:32:09.000000000', 'message': 'Show share network details to non-admin

Horizon attempts to show associated share servers when displaying
share network details in the project share-networks dashboard.  But
unless the horizon user is an admin this generates a 403 exception
which in turn causes Horizon to pop-up an error message about being
unable to retrieve share network details.

So instead catch exceptions collecting share server information in
this context and continue on gracefully, presenting the share server
details that are available.

Change-Id: I822ba95dc8e41df2775f908c287565f5da6a7e9d
Closes-Bug: #1702396
'}]
commit_message:
Show share network details to non-admin

Horizon attempts to show associated share servers when displaying
share network details in the project share-networks dashboard.  But
unless the horizon user is an admin this generates a 403 exception
which in turn causes Horizon to pop-up an error message about being
unable to retrieve share network details.

So instead catch exceptions collecting share server information in
this context and continue on gracefully, presenting the share server
details that are available.

Change-Id: I822ba95dc8e41df2775f908c287565f5da6a7e9d
Closes-Bug: #1702396

commit_message:
Fix share replica details page for non-admins

Non-administrators cannot access share instance
export locations by the virtue of default policy.

Fix this retrieval to not error-out showing the
whole page.

Change-Id: I5f78e7fbfbf4ce93f9c1658609f20f179c6995a6
Closes-Bug: #1787016

commit_message:
Don't show host field in project tables

We already suppress this information in non-admin contexts in
manila itself [1] so drop the field from the project view
tables.

Closes-Bug: #1664370
[1] I799bb7378927b6c3ee0f9fe88fd9876a03dd85b5

Change-Id: I00b99b082a4188e0e95c7a055da0fa28c5541338

[{'account_id': 16643, 'date': '2019-04-03 00:14:58.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 16643, 'date': '2019-04-03 00:20:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Some screenshots after this change was applied, along with https://review.openstack.org/#/c/649184/:


Share network has share servers, but no security services:

* Non-admin user - https://imgur.com/oJJCshs
* Admin user - https://imgur.com/4HfQy0h

commit_message:
Add share servers to share network detail

We're missing share servers in the network
detailed view. Also, it's not helpful to
show either Share Servers or Security Services
when none exist (or are not retrievable).

Change-Id: Iacb8145f7865d73c479130cbe94078b4cc5c831a
Partial-Bug: #1702396

[{'created': '2019-03-06 08:23:18.000000000', 'message': 'Encrypt certs and keys

Octavia creates certificates and keys to manage encrypted
communication channel to amphorae.
When debug is enabled, the python taskflow module will log
all the information we provide to tasks (and sub-flows)
when we create amphorae or handle with anything related to
certificates and keys management (rotations, etc).

There are ways to tell taskflow to exclude specific things
from being logged (e.g., I136081045787c1bbe3ee846d5845a34201c57864).
While this handles some information in specific flows from being
logged, it is susceptive to code changes.

To avoid an everlasting whack-a-mole game, this patch will merely
encrypt sensitive information so we can safely log it and decrypts
it only when we need to use it.

Conflicts:
       octavia/controller/worker/controller_worker.py
       octavia/controller/worker/tasks/amphora_driver_tasks.py

(cherry picked from commit dc4c0b624902201f2d9d55373abc1da744ba57fa)
'}]
commit_message:
Encrypt certs and keys

Octavia creates certificates and keys to manage encrypted
communication channel to amphorae.
When debug is enabled, the python taskflow module will log
all the information we provide to tasks (and sub-flows)
when we create amphorae or handle with anything related to
certificates and keys management (rotations, etc).

There are ways to tell taskflow to exclude specific things
from being logged (e.g., I136081045787c1bbe3ee846d5845a34201c57864).
While this handles some information in specific flows from being
logged, it is susceptive to code changes.

To avoid an everlasting whack-a-mole game, this patch will merely
encrypt sensitive information so we can safely log it and decrypts
it only when we need to use it.

Conflicts:
       octavia/controller/worker/controller_worker.py
       octavia/controller/worker/tasks/amphora_driver_tasks.py
       octavia/controller/worker/tasks/database_tasks.py
       octavia/tests/unit/controller/worker/tasks/test_database_tasks.py

Change-Id: I06d329ca53bc36bd27f7870ae7c7ca0cf18575b2
(cherry picked from commit ae7c87f54a6c5483a608d5e9fe51ea1966ea1f7e)
(cherry picked from commit dc4c0b624902201f2d9d55373abc1da744ba57fa)

commit_message:
Update apparmor job to only use docker default profile

This updates the apparmor job to only use the docker default
profile for memcached, as the custom apparmor profiles used didnt
allow for a successful deployment. This also updates the libvirt
overrides, as the current change to use daemonset-overrides
required updating the container name.

Change-Id: I1fd6ca48b9f9cc0e08c18a9347487d26bc6724d8

commit_message:
[api-ref] Replace "tenant" terminology with "project"

Nowadays "project" and "project_id" are used instead of "tenant" in
the OpenStack world. See [1] and [2].

- Replace "tenant_id" in the API paths to "project_id"
- For most manila resources, the "project_id" in an API response body
  refers to the project that owns the resource. So, create a unified
  parameter and share that across the APIs.
- Fix path variable names, and their order
- Fix usage of "UUID" to refer to project and user IDs
- Fix query parameters

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/operations-guide/ops-projects-users.html
[2] https://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/identity/v3/index.html#projects

Partial-Bug: #1760644
Co-Authored-By: Goutham Pacha Ravi <gouthampravi@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I64e4ef8ad258d07c7d80d11a4d015c4b82156722

commit_message:
ipmi: Ignore sensor debug data

When the conductor has debugging enabled, that command is
passed to ipmitool to enable debugging of other commands.

However, this means tons of extra data is dumped as part of
the sensor data collection for ironic, which breaks string
parsing and ultimately metrics collection.

Since we can identify these lines, lets ignore them.

Change-Id: Ife77707210f8289d8f2e0223fb9ee1909d798546
Story: 2005332
Task: 30267

[{'created': '2019-03-24 22:14:38.000000000', 'message': 'Replace openstack.org git:// URLs with https://

This is a mechanically generated change to replace openstack.org
git:// URLs with https:// equivalents.

This is in aid of a planned future move of the git hosting
infrastructure to a self-hosted instance of gitea (https://gitea.io),
which does not support the git wire protocol at this stage.

This update should result in no functional change.

For more information see the thread at

 http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-March/003825.html

Change-Id: I15a102aeedff37ea30d6803d20f2e47bed6f3f1c
'}]
commit_message:
Replace openstack.org git:// URLs with https://

This is a mechanically generated change to replace openstack.org
git:// URLs with https:// equivalents.

This is in aid of a planned future move of the git hosting
infrastructure to a self-hosted instance of gitea (https://gitea.io),
which does not support the git wire protocol at this stage.

This update should result in no functional change.

For more information see the thread at

 http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-March/003825.html

Change-Id: I15a102aeedff37ea30d6803d20f2e47bed6f3f1c

commit_message:
Update master for stable/stein

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/stein.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/stein.

Change-Id: I241c58785ff541681113628bb9409821f035b2a2
Sem-Ver: feature

subject: Switch to import_tasks when tags should be applied
messages:
[{'account_id': 28619, 'date': '2019-04-04 15:18:27.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 17799, 'date': '2019-04-04 16:20:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Aside from a "skip_ansible_lint" tag, none of the included tasks in this change appear to have any tags, so this change does not assist with the ability to execute tags.

In the case of configure_metal_hosts.yml this will add a lot of skipped tasks to the run queue unnecessarily so we should not change that one due to its conditional execution. The others are running unconditionally  (for the most part) so this change is fine except I think the effects are negligible.'}, {'account_id': 28619, 'date': '2019-04-04 16:56:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Actually, it has tags openstack_hosts-config and openstack_hosts-config, which might be pretty useful, when you jsut want to update hosts file across all nodes/containers, but do not affect with other tasks (like configuring apt). This might happen every time new computing node is added (as this new record to hosts file should be distributed).

If this patch will create some problems I'm not really aware of, that ok, no problems."}, {'account_id': 28619, 'date': '2019-04-04 16:56:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

2nd tag openstack_hosts-install of course:)'}, {'account_id': 17799, 'date': '2019-04-04 17:12:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

Makes sense now.. I was testing with --skip-tags, however testing the include vs import with --tags it does skip all of the tasks with include. Thanks for clarifying.. LGTM'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2019-04-04 17:15:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-04-04 15:18:27.000000000', 'message': 'Switch to import_tasks when tags should be applied

change include_tasks to import_tasks so that the
tags in the role will work.

Change-Id: I9e9de952be461d026f84677390eed31e814b7876
'}]
commit_message:
Switch to import_tasks when tags should be applied

change include_tasks to import_tasks so that the
tags in the role will work.

Change-Id: I9e9de952be461d026f84677390eed31e814b7876

commit_message:
Update master for stable/stein

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/stein.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/stein.

Change-Id: Id3cc3669d115851fe465a583843b99345ab60586
Sem-Ver: feature

Simplify ssh known_hosts entries for non-default port

'[host]*' matches both default port and non-default port.

Change-Id: Id83bed36f3ab7f8d0fbdbd03f3960307af62fc84
Related-bug: #1789452
(cherry picked from commit c70d197d36d48ce29486e2744a8bc9fda630dd11)

commit_message:
Include ssh known_hosts entries for non-default port

The ssh client no longer appears to accept the regular known hosts entry when
the target is running on a non-default port.
Adding '[host]:*' should fix this, regardless of the port.
However this does not work for the default port so we must include both.

Change-Id: I519ff6053676870dff1bdff60fb1f6b2aa5ee8c9
Closes-bug: #1789452
(cherry picked from commit 876683f317640aa6877f991f2d4d0b098de3b7b3)
(cherry picked from commit 3d5d275c6dfb11ea9410ec9aa926df500cfd22c1)

associated with Cinder's NFS backend.

commit_message:
Switch to use stestr for unit test

According to Openstack summit session [1],
stestr is maintained project to which all Openstack projects should migrate.
So we should switch to stestr.

[1] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/YVR-python-pti

Change-Id: Ib10e4f3ac8344f5129ce355c093e567fb2b1eba0

Update json module to jsonutils

oslo project provide jsonutils, and pankoclient use it in many place[1],
this PS to update the remained json module to oslo jsonutils for
consistency.

Change-Id: Id05dcc9de18fe1e594920843f79970e72bde940c

commit_message:
Remove PyPI downloads

According to official site,
https://packaging.python.org/guides/analyzing-pypi-package-downloads/
PyPI package download statistics is no longer maintained and thus
should be removed.

Change-Id: I6d92a4548c00a845b24dd143f5354f7b43209b59

commit_message:
Test using integrated build

In order to do a more complete verification of any patches,
we add a full uncontainerised OpenStack deployment to do the
functional testing using the integrated repo. This replaces
the previous functional test mechanism.

Any additional role tests are left as-is. They will require
some extra implementation in the integrated build before they
can be transferred.

There are some developer mode references that are causing the
role to not run properly due to an undefined variable.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/649397
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/649442
Change-Id: Ib021b074d4675ca5a3164cfd5f0196d347740639

commit_message:
Remove scanning upgrade checker from opts generation

The upgrade checker is going to need to be able to load
configuration settings to check for things that will
interfere with an upgrade.  This will cause genopts
to incorrectly think an entry needs to be added in
cinder/opts.py .  This change add status.py to the
exception list.

Change-Id: Iab71497b5e9405429976b385dde2f6b7d585abae

commit_message:
Update master for stable/stein

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/stein.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/stein.

Change-Id: Icc075fced9df5668bd52903191ef5f39f29aaa24

commit_message:
handlers: check for default IP instead of 127.0.0.1

There is no host set for the handler that checks once the service
has gone up.  In certain scenario where you may be running all
metal with HAproxy on the same node, you would want Keystone to
bind to the primary IP only to avoid conflicting with HAproxy.

By doing this, you're no longer listening to 0.0.0.0 which includes
127.0.0.1 and this handler fails.  By switching the handler to hit
the primary IP, you're able to successfully run this task both in
the existing scenario, as well as cover scenario where you are
listening on the primary IP.

Change-Id: I1f519d74ec25abfe37d2952aac92a346ccbf48f6

commit_message:
Switch to CentOS Amphora

Looks like Ubuntu's Amphora is broken, probably due to latest update of
ubuntu-minimal cloud image (which includes cloud-init version bump that
might be the culprit). This commit switches our gates to CentOS amp to
work the problem around until we fix the Ubuntu one.

Also the timeout for the jobs is raised to 3 hours because it seems like
building containers in the gate take ages.

Closes-Bug: 1822862
Change-Id: I3650aac01334e924ca64fcc4e79928141e010e5a

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-30 20:51:40.000000000', 'message': 'prevent common kwargs from glance client failure

When creating a snapshot of a server using the nova API, failure occurs
if the image contains the metadata property "version". This was due to
the way that the GlanceClientWrapper.call() function signature was
structured.

Previous to this patch, the call() method looked like so:

 def call(self, context, version, method, *args, **kwargs):

After this patch, the call() method looks like this:

 def call(self, __client_context, __client_method, *args, **kwargs):

I've removed entirely the old version argument since all call sites are
hard-coding the number 2 (since we no longer support the Glance v1.0
API. Secondly, just for safety, I renamed the "method" and "context"
arguments to the function to be __client_context and __client_method to
give name conflicts a small change of occurring. It's hacky, but besides
a rewrite of the entire awful nova/image/glance.py module, it'll do to
solve the issue in question.

Change-Id: I3ed3303309fe2a25c0043fd206f36bada4b3b8f9
Closes-bug: #1717547
'}, {'created': '2018-10-31 11:48:19.000000000', 'message': 'prevent common kwargs from glance client failure

When creating a snapshot of a server using the nova API, failure occurs
if the image contains the metadata property "version". This was due to
the way that the GlanceClientWrapper.call() function signature was
structured.

Previous to this patch, the call() method looked like so:

 def call(self, context, version, method, *args, **kwargs):

After this patch, the call() method looks like this:

 def call(self, __client_context, __client_method, *args, **kwargs):

I've removed entirely the old version argument since all call sites are
hard-coding the number 2 (since we no longer support the Glance v1.0
API. Secondly, just for safety, I renamed the "method" and "context"
arguments to the function to be __client_context and __client_method to
give name conflicts a small change of occurring. It's hacky, but besides
a rewrite of the entire awful nova/image/glance.py module, it'll do to
solve the issue in question.

Change-Id: I3ed3303309fe2a25c0043fd206f36bada4b3b8f9
Closes-bug: #1717547
'}, {'created': '2018-11-06 16:02:39.000000000', 'message': 'prevent common kwargs from glance client failure

When creating a snapshot of a server using the nova API, failure occurs
if the image contains the metadata property "version". This was due to
the way that the GlanceClientWrapper.call() function signature was
structured.

This patch forces all client positional args to be passed as a named
"args" argument to the call() function and all client named args to be
pass as a named "kwargs" argument to the call() function. This
eliminates any argument name-shadowing that previously caused issues.

Closes-bug: #1717547
Change-Id: I3ed3303309fe2a25c0043fd206f36bada4b3b8f9
'}]
commit_message:
prevent common kwargs from glance client failure

When creating a snapshot of a server using the nova API, failure occurs
if the image contains the metadata property "version". This was due to
the way that the GlanceClientWrapper.call() function signature was
structured.

This patch forces all client positional args to be passed as a named
"args" argument to the call() function and all client named args to be
pass as a named "kwargs" argument to the call() function. This
eliminates any argument name-shadowing that previously caused issues.

Closes-bug: #1717547
Change-Id: I3ed3303309fe2a25c0043fd206f36bada4b3b8f9

commit_message:
Don't warn on network-vif-unplugged event during live migration

The "network-vif-unplugged" event is expected during live migration
and nothing listens for it so we should not log a warning in that case.

Change-Id: I8fd8df211670f1abbcb7b496e62589295922bdc1
Closes-Bug: #1819764

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-04-04 13:48:07.000000000', 'message': 'Remove City Cloud LA1 region

City Cloud is taking their LA1 region offline permanently. We
disabled uploads to it some time back, so it can be cleanly removed
from our configuration at this point.

Change-Id: I18ec8bb71831b8401efc9c6568b129b9b40170a0
'}]
commit_message:
Remove City Cloud LA1 region

City Cloud is taking their LA1 region offline permanently. We
disabled uploads to it some time back, so it can be cleanly removed
from our configuration at this point.

Change-Id: I18ec8bb71831b8401efc9c6568b129b9b40170a0

commit_message:
Transform scheduler.select_destinations notification

Transform the scheduler.select_destinations.start and
scheduler.select_destinations.end notifications to the
versioned notification framework.

Change-Id: I019e88fabd1d386c0d6395a7b1969315873485fd
Implements: bp versioned-notification-transformation-stein

So first of all, IMO [1] is very unfortunate patch. There is $connectors parameter for exactly such configuration. Adding special parameters for one connector should not be done on module side, but on THT side. So while I'm ok with this patch I would not merge it before we will remove duplicates on puppet-qdr side.

commit_message:
[queens-only] Remove primary role constraint to deploy NodeTLSData

NodeTLSData is needed everywhere HAproxy is deployed.
Therefore, if multiple roles have HAproxy, we need to remove the primary
role constraint on this resource otherwise it's only deployed on the
node tagged controller & primary.
With this patch, we'll deploy NodeTLSData on roles tagged "controller".

Change-Id: I670d292f6051a373298e4ff0cc59f763aa3eee63
Closes-Bug: 1822327

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/stein branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I18fb748132a28e61de11b70aca115656c230ec6f
'}]
commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/stein

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/stein branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I18fb748132a28e61de11b70aca115656c230ec6f

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-04-04 14:01:49.000000000', 'message': 'Adapt job timeouts

There were some integration tests running into timeouts while they were
almost finished, so let us increase the timeout for them from 1h to
90mins.

The openstack-chef-delivery job otoh takes only a couple of minutes
usually, so reduce the timeout from 45min to 30min.

Change-Id: I11601843293d1e0c04b4fafb8019261f20cb50ff
'}]
commit_message:
Adapt job timeouts

There were some integration tests running into timeouts while they were
almost finished, so let us increase the timeout for them from 1h to
90mins.

The openstack-chef-delivery job otoh takes only a couple of minutes
usually, so reduce the timeout from 45min to 30min.

Change-Id: I11601843293d1e0c04b4fafb8019261f20cb50ff

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-04-03 18:58:08.000000000', 'message': 'Fix RabbitMQ locale for CentOS 7 (t-h-t part)

It seems that CentOS 7 does not have C.UTF-8 locale. Since we need
UTF-8-based locale, use en_US.UTF-8 instead.

Change-Id: Id510565edd33e6f4d409afc7a4afb938ab2f9fd0
Partial-Bug: #1823062
'}]
commit_message:
Fix RabbitMQ locale for CentOS 7 (t-h-t part)

It seems that CentOS 7 does not have C.UTF-8 locale. Since we need
UTF-8-based locale, use en_US.UTF-8 instead.

Change-Id: Id510565edd33e6f4d409afc7a4afb938ab2f9fd0
Partial-Bug: #1823062

commit_message:
Use Stein release for all OpenStack projects

Versions were generated via the following command:

tools/version-check.py --openstack-release stein --include-independent

Some other versions had to be changed manually, including those not
managed via the OpenStack release process.

Revert this on master once kolla stable/stein branch has been created.

Change-Id: I7cf31fd3ef7d236b9356b379a664968071dbf297

messages: [{'account_id': 13252, 'date': '2019-04-04 14:03:44.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 13252, 'date': '2019-04-04 14:05:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1\n\nSelf-approving change that only amends job timeouts.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-04-04 14:03:44.000000000', 'message': 'Adapt job timeouts

There were some integration tests running into timeouts while they were
almost finished, so let us increase the timeout for them from 1h to
90mins.

The openstack-chef-delivery job otoh takes only a couple of minutes
usually, so reduce the timeout from 45min to 30min.

Change-Id: I11601843293d1e0c04b4fafb8019261f20cb50ff
(cherry picked from commit 141190bc661d1b88a2e9cac07490d0a1869c6895)
'}]
commit_message:
Adapt job timeouts

There were some integration tests running into timeouts while they were
almost finished, so let us increase the timeout for them from 1h to
90mins.

The openstack-chef-delivery job otoh takes only a couple of minutes
usually, so reduce the timeout from 45min to 30min.

Change-Id: I11601843293d1e0c04b4fafb8019261f20cb50ff
(cherry picked from commit 141190bc661d1b88a2e9cac07490d0a1869c6895)

commit_message:
Have lib/tempest to create shared network

In order to make sure not possible to introduce a change in tempest
which breaks the shared network compatibility.

Depends-On: I6e3e53c4ac26b4fef09fefb9c590dfa91f577565

Change-Id: Ib2e7096175c991acf35de04e840ac188752d3c17

commit_message:
Revert "Force C.UTF-8 when dealing with rabbitmq"

This reverts commit bc9b922ddcdb6625b0e4c8b67851b3843d1d8775.

This seems to have broken the upgrade jobs. It might just
be the HA configurations which we've dropped from most jobs.
Related-Bug: #1823062
Change-Id: I300dc69ebd93728d792746c6bce798e0391de17c

subject: Release keystone 14.1.0 for stable/rocky
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 5046, 'name': 'Lance Bragstad', 'email': 'lbragstad@redhat.com', 'username': 'ldbragst'}, {'_account_id': 8482, 'name': 'Colleen Murphy', 'email': 'colleen@gazlene.net', 'username': 'krinkle'}, {'_account_id': 11904, 'name': 'Sean McGinnis', 'email': 'sean.mcginnis@gmail.com', 'username': 'SeanM'}, {'_account_id': 12898, 'name': 'Tony Breeds', 'email': 'tony@bakeyournoodle.com', 'username': 'tonyb'}, {'_account_id': 14288, 'name': 'Matthew Thode', 'display_name': 'prometheanfire', 'email': 'mthode@mthode.org', 'username': 'prometheanfire'}, {'_account_id': 16312, 'name': 'Alfredo Moralejo', 'email': 'amoralej@redhat.com', 'username': 'amoralej'}, {'_account_id': 17068, 'name': 'Jean-Philippe Evrard', 'email': 'openstack@a.spamming.party', 'username': 'evrardjp'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 8482, 'date': '2019-03-20 21:48:12.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 5046, 'date': '2019-03-20 21:48:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2019-03-22 18:53:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2019-03-24 23:15:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

We can't release this as it includes a minimum version bump for ldappool (https://review.openstack.org/#/c/613648/)

Ideally that'd be reverted, as it's a policy violation and will break at least gentoo and centos consumers.  However I get that it's a critical bug is there no way to fix the issues *without* the bump?"}, {'account_id': 14288, 'date': '2019-03-24 23:43:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

that's my understanding, kinda a catch 22

as far as gentoo goes, ldappool 2.1.0 is stable now and 2.3.1 will be on april 13th (before this version would go stable, if packaged today it'd be stable april 24th)."}, {'account_id': 8482, 'date': '2019-03-26 07:46:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Yes, it's a critical bug and I don't see a way around it without including the ldappool version bump.

If it factors in at all, opensuse follows the stable branches so we already accounted for the new package in our Rocky keystone packages, so it's not among the distros this will break."}, {'account_id': 8482, 'date': '2019-03-26 13:53:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

As another data point, the bug was reported and fixed by one of the Ubuntu maintainers.'}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2019-03-26 22:35:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> As another data point, the bug was reported and fixed by one of the
 > Ubuntu maintainers.

That doesn't really change the fact this is a policy violation to bump a minimum on a stable branch, and it isn't a small bump 2.0.0 -> 2.3.1 is pretty big.  It's true that 2.3.1 is the current upper-constraint, so in theory all distros should be running that version but ....

openSUSE: ok (by assertion)
Gentoo: ok'ish (by assertion)
UCA: ok (assumption) 
Debian: ok [1]
CentOS/RDO: Broken [2]

but CentOS/RDO doesn't support python3 so will the rocky keystone work correctly on py2 with python-ldappool 2.1.0?  Nothing is testing that in a gate anywhere so it isn't a thing I can easily confirm.

I can start the process for getting 2.3.1 into CentOS/RDO but it'll take a few days and is exactly the kind of work the policy is supposed to avoid :/

[1] https://salsa.debian.org/openstack-team/python/python-ldappool/commit/bd48694e03858a56a70368d8d261d4968475d111
[2] https://trunk.rdoproject.org/centos7-rocky/deps/latest/SRPMS/python-ldappool-2.1.0-1.el7.src.rpm"}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2019-03-26 22:49:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> Yes, it's a critical bug and I don't see a way around it without
 > including the ldappool version bump.

Can you not do the unicode translations in keystone?  I guess not and that would be another and probably harder to maintain violation :/"}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2019-03-26 22:55:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> I can start the process for getting 2.3.1 into CentOS/RDO but it'll
 > take a few days and is exactly the kind of work the policy is
 > supposed to avoid :/

Turns out I can't do that with my Fedora[1] account :(

[1] Yup Fedora ;P  We need to get 2.3.1 in Fedora, then CentOS/RDO then on the rocky branch"}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2019-03-27 08:08:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> > I can start the process for getting 2.3.1 into CentOS/RDO but
 > it'll
 > > take a few days and is exactly the kind of work the policy is
 > > supposed to avoid :/
 > 
 > Turns out I can't do that with my Fedora[1] account :(
 > 
 > [1] Yup Fedora ;P  We need to get 2.3.1 in Fedora, then CentOS/RDO
 > then on the rocky branch

Waiting for communication to packagers before voting positively"}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2019-03-27 08:14:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> > > I can start the process for getting 2.3.1 into CentOS/RDO but
 > > it'll
 > > > take a few days and is exactly the kind of work the policy is
 > > > supposed to avoid :/
 > >
 > > Turns out I can't do that with my Fedora[1] account :(
 > >
 > > [1] Yup Fedora ;P  We need to get 2.3.1 in Fedora, then
 > CentOS/RDO
 > > then on the rocky branch
 > 
 > Waiting for communication to packagers before voting positively

Discussed in #openstack-keystone today."}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2019-03-27 13:38:49.000000000', 'content': 'Removed Code-Review+2 by Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>
'}, {'account_id': 16312, 'date': '2019-03-27 14:37:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

> > > I can start the process for getting 2.3.1 into CentOS/RDO but
 > > it'll
 > > > take a few days and is exactly the kind of work the policy is
 > > > supposed to avoid :/
 > >
 > > Turns out I can't do that with my Fedora[1] account :(
 > >
 > > [1] Yup Fedora ;P  We need to get 2.3.1 in Fedora, then
 > CentOS/RDO
 > > then on the rocky branch
 > 
 > Waiting for communication to packagers before voting positively

We have python-ldappool 2.4.0 both in fedora [1] and RDO in Stein [2], so this is fine from RDO side.

[1] https://koji.fedoraproject.org/koji/buildinfo?buildID=1210219
[2] https://review.rdoproject.org/r/#/c/19128/"}, {'account_id': 8482, 'date': '2019-03-27 15:33:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Tony - I verified that the unit tests pass with python2.7 using ldappool==2.1.0 - http://paste.openstack.org/show/748460/

Alfredo - this is a rocky release, so I'm not sure the version of ldappool available in RDO for Stein is relevant?"}, {'account_id': 16312, 'date': '2019-03-28 08:38:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> Tony - I verified that the unit tests pass with python2.7 using
 > ldappool==2.1.0 - http://paste.openstack.org/show/748460/
 > 
 > Alfredo - this is a rocky release, so I'm not sure the version of
 > ldappool available in RDO for Stein is relevant?

ups, i missread it, sorry. 

 > Tony - I verified that the unit tests pass with python2.7 using
 > ldappool==2.1.0 - http://paste.openstack.org/show/748460/
 > 

We currently have 2.1.0 in RDO Rocky. It'd be good if we can keep it, otherwise we will update it. Comparing 2.3.1 and 2.4.0, i'd say there is no changes breaking backwards compatibility, so i'd say we could use 2.4.0 for Rocky quite safely in RDO, wdyt?

 > Alfredo - this is a rocky release, so I'm not sure the version of
 > ldappool available in RDO for Stein is relevant?

Yes, sorry, i misread the review."}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2019-03-28 10:13:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

I think with the input of Colleen and Alfredo, we can go ahead.'}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2019-04-01 00:28:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> We currently have 2.1.0 in RDO Rocky. It'd be good if we can keep
 > it, otherwise we will update it. Comparing 2.3.1 and 2.4.0, i'd say
 > there is no changes breaking backwards compatibility, so i'd say we
 > could use 2.4.0 for Rocky quite safely in RDO, wdyt?

I don't think this is an option. RDO's options are:

  1) Stick with ldappool 2.1.0, as the reason for the bump to 2.3.1 is
     largely python3 released and CentOS-7/RDO(rocky) are python2 based
     this is probably okay.  It is however out of sync with the community
     testing statements.  This is the least work for Fedora/RDO and IMO 
     has an acceptable risk profile.

  2) Move to 2.4.0 on rocky,  This similar issues to 1 above.  It's a newer
     version than we have ever tested on rocky.  This has small amounts of
     work for RDO and IMO the greatest risk

  3) Add 2.3.1 to Fedora/RDO and migrate to that as the stable version.
     This is the most work for RDO and keeps it in sync with the community
     testing statements.  This has the lowest risk."}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2019-04-01 00:30:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I'm going to give Alfredo a little time (36hours) to digest my last statement.  Given Colleen's testing I think that RDO will be fine in the short term to stick with 2.1.0 while/if an update to 2.3.1 is prepared.

Leaving my -1 in place until then"}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2019-04-01 09:17:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: -Code-Review

> I'm going to give Alfredo a little time (36hours) to digest my last
 > statement.  Given Colleen's testing I think that RDO will be fine
 > in the short term to stick with 2.1.0 while/if an update to 2.3.1
 > is prepared.
 > 
 > Leaving my -1 in place until then

I agree with that plan, so I will unhide Tony's -1 for the next 36 hours."}, {'account_id': 16312, 'date': '2019-04-02 10:45:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I've built 2.3.1 in RDO and i'm pushing it to rocky https://review.rdoproject.org/r/19898"}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2019-04-04 03:43:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: -Code-Review

> I've built 2.3.1 in RDO and i'm pushing it to rocky
 > https://review.rdoproject.org/r/19898

Thanks!"}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2019-04-04 03:43:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

Given the givens looks good to me.'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2019-04-04 06:12:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2019-04-04 14:02:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1'}]

Change-Id: I0ce2778277640ee9e509c709bf8621b8b025d6d3

commit_message:
Fix spare amphora check and creation

This patch fixes an issue when the SparesPool table is empty that blocks
spare amphorae creation. It creates a new spares pool entry if the table
is empty.

Story 2005352
Task 30306

Change-Id: I0ce2778277640ee9e509c709bf8621b8b025d6d3

commit_message:
Update master for stable/stein

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/stein.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/stein.

Change-Id: Iee01791d3968a744b323fa52ca59aaf835f48925
Sem-Ver: feature

subject: Replace openstack.org git:// URLs with https://

commit_message:
Replace openstack.org git:// URLs with https://

This is a mechanically generated change to replace openstack.org
git:// URLs with https:// equivalents.

This is in aid of a planned future move of the git hosting
infrastructure to a self-hosted instance of gitea (https://gitea.io),
which does not support the git wire protocol at this stage.

This update should result in no functional change.

For more information see the thread at

 http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-March/003825.html

Change-Id: Ia852b0748dcd099f88ee4521117fe0806018788d

commit_message:
Use gabbi-tempest job from gabbi-tempest plugin

That plugin[1] makes it possible to create small zuul jobs that define a
GABBI_TEMPEST_PATH, pointing to where the gabbits are. Resulting in a
very low-config way to do gabbi integration tests.

Therefore, we change the existing placement-tempest-gabbi job into
placement-gabbi-tempest (a name more aligned with the preferred naming
scheme for tempest-related jobs) and remove the no longer required
tempest-gabbi-link playbook.

[1] https://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/gabbi-tempest

Change-Id: Ica4789e5ed3112ec47a1f144242751dcee7eb853

 > tests that tempest already runs, like the tempest.api.compute
 > stuff.

I'd rather not run tempest-full, if possible, because that's too much testing and takes too long, but that's a personal preference and it's not up to just me."}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2018-11-13 09:48:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 34:

We were just discussing on IRC, but I definitely feel that placement should be running tempest full and grenade jobs. Just like glance, keystone and neutron, landing something in a project that other projects depend on justifies a valid set of tests, IMHO.'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2018-11-13 09:49:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 34:

See http://p.anticdent.org/3a5z for some additional conversation about needing to add tempest-full and grenade jobs'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2018-11-13 10:52:04.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 35.'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-11-13 13:13:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 35:

So given https://review.openstack.org/#/c/617565/ what do we do with this change? I know you spent a lot of time getting this to work, but it's also largely redundant with what we'd get out of the tempest-full-py35 job in the integrated gate, and arguably what we should be using anyway rather than a more isolated set of tests just housed within the placement repo."}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2018-11-13 14:03:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 35:

> So given https://review.openstack.org/#/c/617565/ what do we do
 > with this change? I know you spent a lot of time getting this to
 > work, but it's also largely redundant with what we'd get out of the
 > tempest-full-py35 job in the integrated gate, and arguably what we
 > should be using anyway rather than a more isolated set of tests
 > just housed within the placement repo.

If it doesn't go in placement, that's not the end of the world. Getting it to work was a thing I wanted to do to flesh out all the bits and pieces of "gabbi-based tempests tests" working.

However, my preference would be to keep it, because from the placement standpoint, there are times when being able to write a placement-specific integration test is handy, gabbi is the language of scenario testing in placement, and it is _way_ easier and faster to write them with gabbi.

It's not redundant with the integrated-test template, because that doesn't have gabbi-driven placement specific (or any placement specific) tests and this is only that. It doesn't run the rest of tempest, just the gabbits.

Basically, the goal here is to be able to write integration tests for placement without needing to "wait" on tempest. The following patch makes it more lightweight and simple: very close to just adding gabbi files in a directory.'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2018-11-21 10:41:12.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 36: Patch Set 35 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 9708, 'date': '2018-11-27 10:28:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 36:

It appears the problem was https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1817633 so I've rebased this on to the fix for that."}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-02-25 23:54:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 42: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2019-02-25 23:56:10.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 43.'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-02-26 00:00:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 43: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2019-02-26 00:28:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 43:

(1 comment)

note to self within, might do it as a follow up, and just apply it to the tidier gabbi-tempest based version (which is in the next patch)'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-03-25 14:19:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 43:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-03-25 14:21:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 43:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2019-03-25 15:15:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 43:

(3 comments)

My comments on ps35 still apply here. We don't have to do this but there are reasons within and on p35 for why we might like to.

If we don't, that's totally cool with me, but I'd like to take this off the radar if that's the decision we make rather than it just sitting here with me rebasing it every now and again.

I'm totally biased: As I made clear in IRC I really think tempest is a bad implementation. As Matt's comments indicate, something like tempest is necessary in the role that it is filling and right now it is the only thing filling that co-gating, integrated-gate role and that is unlikely to change soon. I created gabbi-tempest to see if people would light up to the potential of a purely api-driven & null-client way of doing tempest tests. They haven't, because people don't have time for such frivolity. That's cool. It happens.

So the way to evaluate this is on the question: Do we like the idea of having some gabbi-driven integration tests in placement? Are they sufficiently useful without being too redundant?

Again, to be crystal clear: If we kill this it's totally okay with me. But if we've got reasons to have it, we may as well."}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2019-04-04 13:54:14.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

this doesn't appear to have legs. We can bring it up again later if so moved."}]

'}, {'created': '2018-10-02 08:02:48.000000000', 'message': "Initial integration test using gabbits

This provides a gabbi-tempest based integration (with nova)
test for placement. A zuul playbook is provided which runs
tempest with the gabbi-tempest plugin. Gabbits come from
gate/gabbits. Adding more tests (once this has merged) is
a simply matter of adding more gabbi files in that directory.

This patch provides two gabbi files:

* base.yaml checks the version of the placement service
* basic-server.yaml boots a server and checks allocations and
  usage change as expected through a resize

A custom playbook is provided so we can link gate/gabbits into
the tempest directory, where they can be found by the plugin.
This reuses the roles from the usual devstack-tempest playbook.

This is not yet a perfect solution but it does move us in the
right direction. Things to consider for future iterations:

* Not installing gabbi-tempst from github.

* More granular control over which services are runnning so
  that build time before we get to the actual tests is short.

* Updating tempest's built-in tox setup and zuul configuration
  so that the GABBI_TEMPEST_PATH variable can be used, removing
  the need for the gate/gabbits symlink. GABBI_TEMPEST_PATH
  allows one or more directories to be searched for gabbits.
  The end game is being able to make a zuul job which sets just
  that, and then the magic happens.

For future reference, one thing that was rather confusing for me
in this process is that zuul v3 and devstack aren't entirely playing
well together. zuul does it's own cloning of relevant repos, and
then later devstack does too, to somewhere else. As a result of
that confusion, I had originally been trying to make the symlink
in the wrong place.

The Depends-On is necessary to get a working devstack.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/600162/
Change-Id: I6740a6c1b57c8707c790bf5ca46f819c7ac738d8

commit_message:
Initial integration test using gabbits

This provides a gabbi-tempest based integration (with nova)
test for placement. A zuul playbook is provided which runs
tempest with the gabbi-tempest plugin. Gabbits come from
gate/gabbits. Adding more tests (once this has merged) is
a simply matter of adding more gabbi files in that directory.

This patch provides two gabbi files:

* base.yaml checks the version of the placement service
* basic-server.yaml boots a server and checks allocations and
  usage change as expected through a resize. Because resize
  can take fairly inconsistent amounts of time to accomplish
  we wait for up to 5 minutes for VERIFY_RESIZE.

A custom playbook is provided so we can link gate/gabbits into
the tempest directory, where they can be found by the plugin.
This reuses the roles from the usual devstack-tempest playbook.

This is not yet a perfect solution but it does move us in the
right direction. A followup patch to this includes many of
these improvements. This is kept as two separate patches as
this one helps make the variety of pieces involved more clear.

* Not installing gabbi-tempest from github.

* More granular control over which services are runnning so
  that build time before we get to the actual tests is short.

* Updating tempest's built-in tox setup and zuul configuration
  so that the GABBI_TEMPEST_PATH variable can be used, removing
  the need for the gate/gabbits symlink. GABBI_TEMPEST_PATH
  allows one or more directories to be searched for gabbits.
  The end game is being able to make a zuul job which sets just
  that, and then the magic happens.

For future reference, one thing that was rather confusing for me
in this process is that zuul v3 and devstack aren't entirely playing
well together. zuul does it's own cloning of relevant repos, and
then later devstack does too, to somewhere else. As a result of
that confusion, I had originally been trying to make the symlink
in the wrong place.

Change-Id: I6740a6c1b57c8707c790bf5ca46f819c7ac738d8

commit_message:
stop using common_db_mixin

This patch removes all use of common_db_mixin. All methods of that
class are available in some form from neutron-lib and we are removing
the mixing from neutron soon.

Change-Id: I80d17a491d4468a94f4ae184f1b453f41cdf92a2

commit_message:
Release freezer for 7.1.0 and 2.2.0

At the last vPTG, The freezer team decided to release
freezer using the cycle-with-intermediary method.

- freezer-api: 7.1.0
- freezer: 7.1.0
- freezer-web-ui: 7.1.0

Change-Id: Ib9709ef6899b87a0c28fbf9f0c4e6af083f5de45

commit_message:
The script name displayed is separated by spaces when the exec job is abnormal;
such as,when i execute 'freezer-agent --action exec --command /home/backup.sh',
reported error:while executing script / h o m e / b a c k u p . s h return code was 1 instead of 0

Change-Id: Iea2f04af8672b3abd4f684b7cb5120a9e1b77cf9

commit_message:
Add NetApp E-Series Driver to Removal List

While auditing drivers that were removed during the Stein
release I noticed that the NetApp E-Series removal was
not notated in the support matrix.  This patch corrects
that mistake.

Change-Id: Ie4fe7a26b59b4142eb7a379e8cdea228cef24b27

commit_message:
Replace openstack.org git:// URLs with https://

This is a mechanically generated change to replace openstack.org
git:// URLs with https:// equivalents.

This is in aid of a planned future move of the git hosting
infrastructure to a self-hosted instance of gitea (https://gitea.io),
which does not support the git wire protocol at this stage.

This update should result in no functional change.

For more information see the thread at

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-March/003825.html

Change-Id: Ia4da4f94ecada34246a4db95174fa42595f9ff86

[{'account_id': 12281, 'date': '2019-03-20 10:52:25.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 9963, 'date': '2019-03-20 10:57:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2019-03-20 10:57:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

We need to provide a release note to warn of the change.

Please note I believe this is by far better for EVERYONE, not only those rocky/python3 users. We would default to a very stable backend. 

We can still advise in the release notes for those who want to pool connections to use the current one (we are using eventlet after all), but I believe this is a safer defaults for MANY cases.

I also believe this is a precedent, and we should enable cache in many places, not only nova.'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2019-03-20 10:57:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

 > many places, not only nova.

commit_message:
change the nova cache to dogpile.cache.memcached

Currently there are issues with using the memcache_pool backend as
the memcache driver for nova under python3[0][1] which doesnt seem
like they have a quick fix or something that is backportable to
rocky

This moves the default cache from oslo_cache.memcache_pool to
dogpile.cache.memcached so we can move forward with python3
enabled images.

[0] https://bugs.launchpad.net/cloud-archive/+bug/1812672
[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/oslo.cache/+bug/1812935

Change-Id: I65a4770c374357a8e1c80d904bcd4af36217448f

commit_message:
libvirt: smbfs: Use 'writeback' QEMU cache mode

The 'writethrough' cache mode is terribly slow.  Use the saner
alternative, "writeback" cache mode.

See further details in the documentation of change Ibe236988af2
("libvirt: Use 'writeback' QEMU cache mode when 'none' is not viable).

Related-Bug: #1818847

Change-Id: I2d84c8576c01202fa4ec73a57aa739e2a2f66d06
Signed-off-by: Kashyap Chamarthy <kchamart@redhat.com>

install_command was just running the install and that the dependencies
and constraints were being set using "deps = ".

This fixed the install_command and deps to follow the expected pattern
so the lower-constraints job actual does install the lower constraints.

commit_message:
Fix lower-constraint deps handling

When the lower-constraints tox target was added, it was assumed the
install_command was just running the install and that the dependencies
and constraints were being set using "deps = ".

This fixed the install_command and deps to follow the expected pattern
so the lower-constraints job actual does install the lower constraints.

This also raises the oslo.context minimum as
Ic96c1f1e1a80099d9dafa95a014fc47f05b88e42 added a dependency on a newer
versions kwarg.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/647726/

Change-Id: I4cc2c3ac158a607b22295c50f83896969a4007ee
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Sync policy.json files with service projects

Policies are generated using oslopolicy-sample-generator
according to Horizon 'Policy file maintenance' guide [1].

[1]
https://docs.openstack.org/horizon/latest/contributor/topics/policy.html#policy-file-maintenance

Change-Id: If31c072ab14e1746969b7f94e6837722cefa28ea
Closes-Bug: #1821289

commit_message:
docs: drop sphinxmark

sphinxmark is no longer compatible with the latest release of Sphinx
which is causing all of our documentation jobs to fail.  This patch
removes it as our current usage of openstacktheme for documentation
already provides watermarks for current branch and notices for which
branch the documentation covers.

Change-Id: I620380741243cf16307ef106d67d44a820b0fbb4

commit_message:
docs: drop sphinxmark

sphinxmark is no longer compatible with the latest release of Sphinx
which is causing all of our documentation jobs to fail.  This patch
removes it as our current usage of openstacktheme for documentation
already provides watermarks for current branch and notices for which
branch the documentation covers.

Update swift from 2.15.1 to 2.15.2

Since no data is available in devstack in our functional test environment,

commit_message:
Asserting 'summary get' returns nothing in functional tests

Since no data is available in devstack in our functional test environment,
we make the assertion that 'summary get' returns nothing. This is prone to
update if more complete test scenarios are implemented.

Change-Id: Ic80e39f0d2a75882762ebd6a0dba46033c9fd7f4
(cherry picked from commit a7e687f7405c8c7fb36762c7725fffa7b19895f7)

'}, {'created': '2019-04-04 08:13:40.000000000', 'message': 'Fix Generate test-list file task

Currently in Generate test-list file task, shell script used to
generate test-list gets cancatnates with the whitelist-file
options leading to saying whitelist file not found.

Removing - from jinja conditionals fixes the issue

Change-Id: I05f08cfbaca4d030d20079f22080340d6e1c7239

commit_message:
Fix Generate test-list file task

Currently in Generate test-list file task, shell script used to
generate test-list gets cancatnates with the whitelist-file
options leading to saying whitelist file not found.

Removing - from jinja conditionals fixes the issue

Change-Id: I05f08cfbaca4d030d20079f22080340d6e1c7239
Signed-off-by: Chandan Kumar <chkumar@redhat.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-03-26 14:31:08.000000000', 'message': "Fix redis expected parameter type

This patch changes expected types of Redis' parameters from string to
integer because in Redis driver during parsing info all values
are converted to integer or float.

Change-Id: Ibb0cba582889c7e3dca3b8bd8b50e3103e954aee
"}]
commit_message:
Fix redis expected parameter type

This patch changes expected types of Redis' parameters from string to
integer because in Redis driver during parsing info all values
are converted to integer or float.

Change-Id: Ibb0cba582889c7e3dca3b8bd8b50e3103e954aee

commit_message:
Allow running a no-op validation

The idea here is to be able to run a validation
called np-op in order to test the framework in the CI.

Also we should create a group validation called no-op running
only this validation.

Change-Id: Ied6eaa4009d624737d2dfac8a61f3a273537ce13

Use fedora28-stein dlrn path for periodics

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-03-14 15:47:42.000000000', 'message': 'libvirt: vzstorage: Use 'writeback' QEMU cache mode

The 'writethrough' cache mode is terribly slow.  Use the saner
alternative, "writeback" cache mode.

See further details in the documentation of change Ibe236988af2
("libvirt: Use 'writeback' QEMU cache mode for Nova instances").

Change-Id: I5aae681bc8e8feb7703a89f91b942360dd69c35d
Signed-off-by: Kashyap Chamarthy <kchamart@redhat.com>
'}, {'created': '2019-03-14 16:00:05.000000000', 'message': 'libvirt: vzstorage: Use 'writeback' QEMU cache mode

("libvirt: Use 'writeback' QEMU cache mode for Nova instances").

Related-Bug: #1818847

commit_message:
libvirt: vzstorage: Use 'writeback' QEMU cache mode

The 'writethrough' cache mode is terribly slow.  Use the saner
alternative, "writeback" cache mode.

See further details in the documentation of change Ibe236988af2
("libvirt: Use 'writeback' QEMU cache mode when 'none' is not viable).

Related-Bug: #1818847

Change-Id: I5aae681bc8e8feb7703a89f91b942360dd69c35d
Signed-off-by: Kashyap Chamarthy <kchamart@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Set the lower version of sphinxcontrib-pecanwsme to 0.10.0

* Sphinx 2.0.0 was released on Mar 28 and sphinxcontrib-pecanwsme
  became incompatible with it. The version 0.10.0 was released
  to fix that.
* See https://review.openstack.org/#/c/649264/

Depends-On: I0378297e099412191a4adc41e53b0eb23f6c43ae
Change-Id: Icb0163f553af690192bfab0e192a32d793db28a9

commit_message:
fix rabbitmq config

- since we are using distro_packages for rabbitmq the default rabbitmq
  config name is broken overriding this attribute fixes this
- bugfix version bumped

Change-Id: Ia732d5ac4c64eab2126bbc385998585c96ff23d9
(cherry picked from commit 3187b91c8f9228662b24ed9de0a6780d004b251b)

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-03-26 12:34:57.000000000', 'message': 'Fix openstack-tox-lower-constraint TIMED_OUT Error

When use tox-elower-constraint, we will meet these errors:

1. line 417, in test_clients_ironic:
b"AssertionError: Expected call: Client('1', endpoint_override...
b"Actual call: Client('1', 'http://localhost:6385/'...

2. line 39, in test_wrong_major_version:
b"KeyError: 'HTTP_ACCEPT'"

For the first error, The reason is that the unittest for the
ironicclient is too strict and must be adapted to the latest code.
In fact, the watcher can use the previous ironicclient version.
Therefore, we modified the unittest so that the watcher does not
have to rely on the latest ironicclient version.

For the second error, The reason is that we need to update the minimum
version of pecan and webOb.

Change-Id: Icb3eda3d27fa4452e13e2dcd3c016cc76fc2c7c7
'}, {'created': '2019-03-27 01:15:40.000000000', 'message': 'Fix openstack-tox-lower-constraint TIMED_OUT Error

When use tox-elower-constraint, we will meet these errors:

1. line 417, in test_clients_ironic:
b"AssertionError: Expected call: Client('1', endpoint_override...
b"Actual call: Client('1', 'http://localhost:6385/'...

2. line 39, in test_wrong_major_version:
b"KeyError: 'HTTP_ACCEPT'"

For the first error, The reason is that the unittest for the
ironicclient is too strict and must be adapted to the latest code.
In fact, the watcher can use the previous ironicclient version.
Therefore, we modified the unittest so that the watcher does not
have to rely on the latest ironicclient version.

For the second error, The reason is that we need to update the minimum
version of pecan and webOb.

Change-Id: Icb3eda3d27fa4452e13e2dcd3c016cc76fc2c7c7
'}, {'created': '2019-03-27 08:06:45.000000000', 'message': 'Fix openstack-tox-lower-constraint TIMED_OUT Error

When use tox-elower-constraint, we will meet these errors:

1. line 417, in test_clients_ironic:
b"AssertionError: Expected call: Client('1', endpoint_override...
b"Actual call: Client('1', 'http://localhost:6385/'...

2. line 39, in test_wrong_major_version:
b"KeyError: 'HTTP_ACCEPT'"

For the first error, The reason is that the unittest for the
ironicclient is too strict and must be adapted to the latest code.
In fact, the watcher can use the previous ironicclient version.
Therefore, we modified the unittest so that the watcher does not
have to rely on the latest ironicclient version.

For the second error, The reason is that we need to update the minimum
version of pecan and webOb.

Change-Id: Icb3eda3d27fa4452e13e2dcd3c016cc76fc2c7c7
'}, {'created': '2019-03-27 08:10:54.000000000', 'message': 'Fix openstack-tox-lower-constraint TIMED_OUT Error

When use tox-elower-constraint, we will meet these errors:

1. line 417, in test_clients_ironic:
b"AssertionError: Expected call: Client('1', endpoint_override...
b"Actual call: Client('1', 'http://localhost:6385/'...

2. line 39, in test_wrong_major_version:
b"KeyError: 'HTTP_ACCEPT'"

For the first error, The reason is that the unittest for the
ironicclient is too strict and must be adapted to the latest code.
In fact, the watcher can use the previous ironicclient version.
Therefore, we modified the unittest so that the watcher does not
have to rely on the latest ironicclient version.

For the second error, The reason is that we need to update the minimum
version of pecan and webOb.

Change-Id: Icb3eda3d27fa4452e13e2dcd3c016cc76fc2c7c7

commit_message:
Fix openstack-tox-lower-constraint TIMED_OUT Error

When use tox-elower-constraint, we will meet these errors:

1. line 417, in test_clients_ironic:
b"AssertionError: Expected call: Client('1', endpoint_override...
b"Actual call: Client('1', 'http://localhost:6385/'...

2. line 39, in test_wrong_major_version:
b"KeyError: 'HTTP_ACCEPT'"

3. RUN END RESULT_TIMED_OUT:
[untrusted : git.openstack.org/openstack-infra/
zuul-jobs/playbooks/tox/run.yaml@master]

For the first error, The reason is that the unittest for the
ironicclient is too strict and must be adapted to the latest code.
In fact, the watcher can use the previous ironicclient version.
Therefore, we modified the unittest so that the watcher does not
have to rely on the latest ironicclient version.

For the second error, The reason is that we need to update the minimum
version of pecan and webOb.

For the third error, the reason is that the version of the oslo_messaging
is too low.

Change-Id: Icb3eda3d27fa4452e13e2dcd3c016cc76fc2c7c7

commit_message:
Remove the tempest_test_whitelist from playbook

Have this fact set here makes hard to override it on featureset.
Removing it, and moving this to featureset_override on job definition

https://tree.taiga.io/project/tripleo-ci-board/task/901?kanban-status=1447275

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/648110
Change-Id: Ia3066bb5d9dab86226576b8a9f5fc6ca06e52f1a

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-11 01:46:01.000000000', 'message': "Remove mox in unit/network/test_neutronv2.py (6)

Replace mox with mock
in test methods in the TestNeutronv2NeutronHostnameDNS class
and the TestNeutronv2NeutronHostnameDNSPortbinding class
in nova/tests/unit/network/test_neutronv2.py.

Remove the following methods of the TestNeutronv2Base class.

* _allocate_for_instance
* _stub_allocate_for_instance
* _stub_allocate_for_instance_show_port
* _stub_allocate_for_instance_list_networks
* _stub_allocate_for_instance_create_port

The original TestNeutronv2Base class is removed and
the _TestNeutronv2Common class is renamed to 'TestNeutronv2Base'.

Subsequent patches will replace mox in other test cases.

Change-Id: I554105d413d980015e5872b24fa8d7022a794a37
Implements: blueprint mox-removal

commit_message:
Remove mox in unit/network/test_neutronv2.py (6)

Replace mox with mock
in test methods in the TestNeutronv2NeutronHostnameDNS class
and the TestNeutronv2NeutronHostnameDNSPortbinding class
in nova/tests/unit/network/test_neutronv2.py.

Remove the following methods of the TestNeutronv2Base class.

* _allocate_for_instance
* _stub_allocate_for_instance
* _stub_allocate_for_instance_show_port
* _stub_allocate_for_instance_list_networks
* _stub_allocate_for_instance_create_port

The original TestNeutronv2Base class is removed and
the _TestNeutronv2Common class is renamed to 'TestNeutronv2Base'.

Subsequent patches will replace mox in other test cases.

Change-Id: I554105d413d980015e5872b24fa8d7022a794a37
Implements: blueprint mox-removal-train

commit_message:
Asserting 'summary get' returns nothing in functional tests

Since no data is available in devstack in our functional test environment,
we make the assertion that 'summary get' returns nothing. This is prone to
update if more complete test scenarios are implemented.

Change-Id: Ic80e39f0d2a75882762ebd6a0dba46033c9fd7f4

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2019-02-19 11:55:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

I like the spirit of this, but hope that as it evolves the name will too. Apart from copyright issue, it just grates: "My little padawan"

But also a question: I don't have a lot of faith that something like this is going to draw in people, but that may be because of the parts of OpenStack that I frequent. Do we have a significant chunk of people asking for in-depth and long-term mentoring partnerships these days? If we do, great, let's make sure those people can connect up. This seems like a potentially reasonable way to do it.

But it feels a bit grasping somehow. I wish I could explain that better because I'm sure I sound not very helpful here.

I guess I feel like if there are things that need to be fixed in OpenStack, we should make it easy for people who need those things to come along. If they don't come along, then they don't need to be fixed.'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2019-02-20 06:45:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

commit_message:
[RFC] Introduce the Padawan program

Short description of what we are trying to achieve with
the Padawan program, along with example entry.

This is a strawman proposal meant to discuss if this is
the direction we want to be going for improving the
help-most-needed list, or if something else is more
desirable.

Change-Id: Ie551287788254fa0d09b47d4c88ba2f681e12eab

commit_message:
Fix issue in 'post_process_heat_template' function

If users specify parameters in 'flavor' or 'image' properties
of a VDU, HOT template can not be processed properly because
there is a missmatch between TOSCA and HOT template.

This patch will change 'get_input' to 'get_param' to fix that
issue.

Co-Authored-By: Dharmendra Kushwaha<dharmendra.kushwaha@india.nec.com> 
Change-Id: I353e9d9d70dc6249a62dcdd1281b7b60d28d7d30
Closes-Bug: #1813135

subject: Improve Mnesia IO performances
messages: [{'account_id': 29364, 'date': '2019-03-28 15:17:09.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 8770, 'date': '2019-04-01 15:13:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2019-04-02 00:29:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2019-04-04 09:17:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-03-28 15:17:09.000000000', 'message': 'Improve Mnesia IO performances

With this configuration, the database Mnesia reduces the activity to the
disk. It is useful when a huge of queues/exchanges/bindings are created
and destroyed.
With the default value (100), RabbitMQ could log {Mnesia is overloaded}.
Moved to 300. The range should be between 100 and 1000.
Read [1] for more info.

[1] http://erlang.org/doc/man/mnesia.html#dump_log_write_threshold

Change-Id: I6dcfc9db02bcd8c8f0a1ebf58d9c3ceb84cae10a
'}]
commit_message:
Improve Mnesia IO performances

With this configuration, the database Mnesia reduces the activity to the
disk. It is useful when a huge of queues/exchanges/bindings are created
and destroyed.
With the default value (100), RabbitMQ could log {Mnesia is overloaded}.
Moved to 300. The range should be between 100 and 1000.
Read [1] for more info.

[1] http://erlang.org/doc/man/mnesia.html#dump_log_write_threshold

Change-Id: I6dcfc9db02bcd8c8f0a1ebf58d9c3ceb84cae10a

subject: Bug-fix: attach_type or control path type should be majuscule.
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-04-04 07:07:38.000000000', 'message': 'Bug-fix: attach_type or control path type should be majuscule.

The sysinfo based fpga driver report attach_type or control path type as "pci"
which will cause an error of creating related object in conductor.

Change-Id: I442511d3232da90484886dbf169b53b8acf4681c
'}]
commit_message:
Bug-fix: attach_type or control path type should be majuscule.

The sysinfo based fpga driver report attach_type or control path type as "pci"
which will cause an error of creating related object in conductor.

Change-Id: I442511d3232da90484886dbf169b53b8acf4681c

commit_message:
docs: drop sphinxmark

sphinxmark is no longer compatible with the latest release of Sphinx
which is causing all of our documentation jobs to fail.  This patch
removes it as our current usage of openstacktheme for documentation
already provides watermarks for current branch and notices for which
branch the documentation covers.

Change-Id: Ia273b2a4ec77e693ee9e523ffbbb193c128b0410

commit_message:
s3token: Add an underscore to the end of reseller_prefix if not present

This matches the behavior of tempauth/keystoneauth with regard to reseller_prefix.

Change-Id: I10f8bc354d0f45dd692915de86857679e9ca3446

which is causing all of our documentation jobs to fail.  This patch
removes it as our current usage of openstacktheme for documentation
already provides watermarks for current branch and notices for which
branch the documentation covers.

Change-Id: I5c84109e985017ccc9a22f5cb07fbedc5bcac92b

commit_message:
Normalize operation messages into capital case

Operation messages use sentence case in html files
(e.g. 'Create port') while capital case in js files
(e.g. 'Create Port'). Normalize them to use capital case in order
not to generate different translation items for same message.

Change-Id: Ic991d42a4a152f237d7df315d104ac802b7104cc

subject: WIP: Created check_and_complete delayed call if it is latest task in branch
messages:
[{'account_id': 27008, 'date': '2018-03-22 10:06:51.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 8731, 'date': '2018-03-22 10:47:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

The idea may be interesting but IMO this won't help much:

1) This job is heavy only for complex workflows, 100 tasks and more plus some tricky topology. But for tricky topologies there's a big probability that some branches will finish quickly (and hence schedule the job).

2) Now we schedule it once for periodic execution when we start a WF, and restart when we rerun/resume the WF. After your patch every branch will create its own job => we'll have more jobs => more load on DB

3) According to the current impl it shouldn't run too often (there's a place that tries to calculate a delay depending on a number of incomplete tasks)


So I'm not convinced at this point. If you get really much more impressive results please share them."}, {'account_id': 27008, 'date': '2018-03-25 11:09:02.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 27008, 'date': '2018-03-25 18:08:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> 1) This job is heavy only for complex workflows, 100 tasks and more
 > plus some tricky topology. But for tricky topologies there's a big
 > probability that some branches will finish quickly (and hence
 > schedule the job).

One job may be not heavy. But this job executes many times for once workflow under load.
Other case is async action. E.g. It will finished in hour. This delayed call is triggered all this time.

 > 2) Now we schedule it once for periodic execution when we start a
 > WF, and restart when we rerun/resume the WF. After your patch every
 > branch will create its own job => we'll have more jobs => more load
 > on DB

Noop. Leafs will create a delayed call. And they is not periodic.
As I understand, my change has impact only if workflow has leafs ~= number of tasks in workflow.
But I think it is not real case.

 > 3) According to the current impl it shouldn't run too often
 > (there's a place that tries to calculate a delay depending on a
 > number of incomplete tasks)

100 tasks = 1 seconds. It is too often.
 
 > So I'm not convinced at this point. If you get really much more
 > impressive results please share them.

I do simple test case.
I have the workflow which consists 20 consequently tasks. Every tasks do a http call during 500 miliseconds.
I have one mistral-engine(1 CPU). I start the 2460 executions (49200 tasks) during one hour using Poisson point process.

Vanilla version:
_schedule_check_and_complete was launched 22094 times
CPU chart - https://imgur.com/2PVyNQx

With my fix:
_schedule_check_and_complete was launched 2460 times
CPU chart - https://imgur.com/ZXCZrxR

Imagine, I process 20000 workflow (400 000 tasks) per hour. I think load on database will be much smaller with my fix."}, {'account_id': 27008, 'date': '2018-04-20 21:21:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 8731, 'date': '2019-04-04 08:51:28.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Not relevant anymore.'}]

Signed-off-by: Vitalii Solodilov <mcdkr@yandex.ru>

'}]
commit_message:
WIP: Created check_and_complete delayed call if it is latest task in branch

A Check_and_complete delayed calls really decrease performance
mistral-engine and database under load.

[{'created': '2017-04-03 19:07:26.000000000', 'message': '[WIP] Workflow Error Analysis Client updates.

The updates propose in this review will compliment the work which will
be done on the mistral engine side for the follow blueprint:

https://blueprints.launchpad.net/mistral/+spec/mistral-error-analysis

Once completed, it will allow the operator to execute a report command
from mistral and receive the formatted output proposed in the spec.

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/443217/

The updates propose in this review will compliment the work which will
be done on the mistral engine side for the follow blueprint:

https://blueprints.launchpad.net/mistral/+spec/mistral-error-analysis

commit_message:
Workflow Error Analysis Client.[WIP]

The updates propose in this review will compliment the work which will
be done on the mistral engine side for the follow blueprint:

https://blueprints.launchpad.net/mistral/+spec/mistral-error-analysis

Once completed, it will allow the operator to execute a report command
from mistral and receive the formatted output proposed in the spec.

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/443217/

Change-Id: I54b0eb1d004bcc0ae510480ad609d4bc2a50f6a8
