[{'created': '2019-03-17 10:42:51.000000000', 'message': "Try enable dnsmasq process several times

Sometimes, during restart of dnsmasq process it may happend that
after process is killed, start attempt is made too fast, before
old process really unbind from IP address on which it was listining.
That cause and issue with starting dnsmasq process again.

In patch [1] disable() method was changed that it can wait
until process is really not active (no pid for it) but that didn't
solved the problem with starting new dnsmasq process completly and
sometimes it still happend, at least in functional tests.

So now, enable() method is changed that it will try to enable
dnsmasq process for 1 minute, until it will really be spawned properly.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/634390/

Change-Id: I18d73b787fa3ab8803e12d5e5eb2bb7109205aba
Closes-Bug: #1811126

commit_message:
Try to enable dnsmasq process several times

Sometimes, during restart of dnsmasq process it may happend that
after process is killed, start attempt is made too fast, before
old process really unbind from IP address on which it was listening.
That causes an issue with starting dnsmasq process again.

In patch [1] disable() method was changed that it can wait
until process is really not active (no pid for it) but that didn't
solve the problem with starting a new dnsmasq process completely and
sometimes it still happens, at least in functional tests.

So now, enable() method is changed so that it will try to enable
dnsmasq process for 1 minute, until it will really be spawned properly.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/634390/

Change-Id: I18d73b787fa3ab8803e12d5e5eb2bb7109205aba
Closes-Bug: #1811126

commit_message:
Setting the lower version of sphinxcontrib-pecanwsme to 0.10.0

* Sphinx 2.0.0 was released on Mar 28 and sphinxcontrib-pecanwsme
  became incompatible with it. The version 0.10.0 was released
  to fix that.
* See https://review.openstack.org/#/c/649264/

Depends-On: I0378297e099412191a4adc41e53b0eb23f6c43ae
Change-Id: Icb0163f553af690192bfab0e192a32d793db28a9

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-03-26 16:57:22.000000000', 'message': 'Add functional test for the JsonFilter

Before this we had no functional testing of the JsonFilter.
Given it is a pretty complicated filter we should have
functional testing for it, so this adds a simple test which
is using a commonly reported pattern which is filtering
hosts based on hypervisor_hostname for trying to build
a baremetal server on a specific ironic node.

Change-Id: Id63d32501c97d2d27e5c61d8d46fff3e3c791505
Related-Bug: #1821764
'}]
commit_message:
Add functional test for the JsonFilter

Before this we had no functional testing of the JsonFilter.
Given it is a pretty complicated filter we should have
functional testing for it, so this adds a simple test which
is using a commonly reported pattern which is filtering
hosts based on hypervisor_hostname for trying to build
a baremetal server on a specific ironic node.

Change-Id: Id63d32501c97d2d27e5c61d8d46fff3e3c791505
Related-Bug: #1821764

commit_message:
Fix issue in 'post_process_heat_template' function

If users specify parameters in 'flavor' or 'image' properties
of a VDU, HOT template can not be processed properly because
there is a missmatch between TOSCA and HOT template.

This patch will change 'get_input' to 'get_param' to fix that
issue.

Change-Id: I353e9d9d70dc6249a62dcdd1281b7b60d28d7d30
Closes-Bug: #1813135
Depends-On: Ib95ed31c70073cb732d41defe5bdc8027eadfeec

commit_message:
docs: drop sphinxmark

sphinxmark is no longer compatible with the latest release of Sphinx
which is causing all of our documentation jobs to fail.  This patch
removes it as our current usage of openstacktheme for documentation
already provides watermarks for current branch and notices for which
branch the documentation covers.

Change-Id: Ia37eea7fad5589cf617f7a584f8c1c7edf479624

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-03-26 14:01:34.000000000', 'message': 'Libvirt: support per node overrides

This commit adds support for per-node overrides to the libvirt chart.

For example, to enable a relaxed ACS check on one host, but not another,
one may have the following in the override values file:

conf:
  overrides:
    libvirt_libvirt:
      hosts:
      - name: host1.fqdn
        conf:
          qemu:
            relaxed_acs_check: 1
      - name: host2.fqdn
        conf:
          qemu:
            relaxed_acs_check: 0

Story: 2005283
Task: 30140

Change-Id: Ia3431db6b78692ec0140cce1bab9bae5937318a4
Signed-off-by: Steven Webster <steven.webster@windriver.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Libvirt: support per node overrides

This commit adds support for per-node overrides to the libvirt chart.

For example, to enable a relaxed ACS check on one host, but not another,
one may have the following in the override values file:

conf:
  overrides:
    libvirt_libvirt:
      hosts:
      - name: host1.fqdn
        conf:
          qemu:
            relaxed_acs_check: 1
      - name: host2.fqdn
        conf:
          qemu:
            relaxed_acs_check: 0

Story: 2005283
Task: 30140

Change-Id: Ia3431db6b78692ec0140cce1bab9bae5937318a4
Signed-off-by: Steven Webster <steven.webster@windriver.com>

subject: Remove recurse: yes for owner/perms on /etc/kolla
messages: [{'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2019-04-01 19:45:41.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2019-04-03 08:13:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Review-Priority+1'}, {'account_id': 22629, 'date': '2019-04-03 12:12:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 23717, 'date': '2019-04-04 06:58:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-04-01 19:45:41.000000000', 'message': 'Remove recurse: yes for owner/perms on /etc/kolla

When kolla-ansible bootstrap-servers is run, it executes one of the
following two tasks:

- name: Ensure node_config_directory directory exists for user kolla
  file:
    path: "{{ node_config_directory }}"
    state: directory
    recurse: true
    owner: "{{ kolla_user }}"
    group: "{{ kolla_group }}"
    mode: "0755"
  become: True
  when: create_kolla_user | bool

- name: Ensure node_config_directory directory exists
  file:
    path: "{{ node_config_directory }}"
    state: directory
    recurse: true
    mode: "0755"
  become: True
  when: not create_kolla_user | bool

On the first run, normally node_config_directory (/etc/kolla/) doesn't
exist, so it is created with kolla:kolla ownership and 0755 permissions.

If we then run 'kolla-ansible deploy', config files are created for
containers in this directory, e.g. /etc/kolla/nova-compute/. Permissions
for those files should be set according to 'config_owner_user' and
'config_owner_group'.

If at some point we again run kolla-ansible bootstrap-servers, it will
recursively set the ownership and permissions of all files in /etc/kolla
to kolla:kolla / 0755.

The solution is to change bootstrap-servers to not set the owner and
permissions recursively. It's also arguable that /etc/kolla should be
owned by 'config_owner_user' and 'config_owner_group', rather than
kolla:kolla, although that's a separate issue.

Change-Id: I24668914a9cedc94d5a6cb835648740ce9ce6e39
Closes-Bug: #1821599
(cherry picked from commit 6b0be5c5bacd91bb94ec6b75715affb9777e568d)
'}]
commit_message:
Remove recurse: yes for owner/perms on /etc/kolla

When kolla-ansible bootstrap-servers is run, it executes one of the
following two tasks:

- name: Ensure node_config_directory directory exists for user kolla
  file:
    path: "{{ node_config_directory }}"
    state: directory
    recurse: true
    owner: "{{ kolla_user }}"
    group: "{{ kolla_group }}"
    mode: "0755"
  become: True
  when: create_kolla_user | bool

- name: Ensure node_config_directory directory exists
  file:
    path: "{{ node_config_directory }}"
    state: directory
    recurse: true
    mode: "0755"
  become: True
  when: not create_kolla_user | bool

On the first run, normally node_config_directory (/etc/kolla/) doesn't
exist, so it is created with kolla:kolla ownership and 0755 permissions.

If we then run 'kolla-ansible deploy', config files are created for
containers in this directory, e.g. /etc/kolla/nova-compute/. Permissions
for those files should be set according to 'config_owner_user' and
'config_owner_group'.

If at some point we again run kolla-ansible bootstrap-servers, it will
recursively set the ownership and permissions of all files in /etc/kolla
to kolla:kolla / 0755.

The solution is to change bootstrap-servers to not set the owner and
permissions recursively. It's also arguable that /etc/kolla should be
owned by 'config_owner_user' and 'config_owner_group', rather than
kolla:kolla, although that's a separate issue.

Change-Id: I24668914a9cedc94d5a6cb835648740ce9ce6e39
Closes-Bug: #1821599
(cherry picked from commit 6b0be5c5bacd91bb94ec6b75715affb9777e568d)

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/stein

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/stein branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I1df6ef7d5645cf370c959d8b2577f20ad7917ef9

[{'created': '2019-03-22 17:42:38.000000000', 'message': "Fix setting of VIP QoS policy

Load balancers were going in to ERROR when updating vip_qos_policy_id in

- QoS extension enabled: the VIP DB data model was incorrectly
  constructed ('vip_qos_policy_id' where it should have been

  'qos_policy_id')
- QoS extension disabled: setting an UUID or None would fail in the LB

  HTTP 202 to the user.

Story: 2004602

Change-Id: Ie974afa52fe70cbab72b7e7f75bf7ee1015e148c

commit_message:
Fix setting of VIP QoS policy

Load balancers were going in to ERROR when updating vip_qos_policy_id in
two different cases:

- QoS extension enabled: the VIP DB data model was incorrectly
  constructed ('vip_qos_policy_id' where it should have been
  'qos_policy_id')
- QoS extension disabled: setting an UUID or None would fail in the LB
  update flow as the extension is disabled, and the API would return
  HTTP 202 to the user.

Story: 2004602
Task: 28512

Change-Id: Ie974afa52fe70cbab72b7e7f75bf7ee1015e148c

subject: Remove recurse: yes for owner/perms on /etc/kolla
messages: [{'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2019-04-01 19:46:32.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2019-04-03 08:13:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Review-Priority+1'}, {'account_id': 22629, 'date': '2019-04-03 12:13:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 23717, 'date': '2019-04-04 06:55:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-04-01 19:46:32.000000000', 'message': 'Remove recurse: yes for owner/perms on /etc/kolla

When kolla-ansible bootstrap-servers is run, it executes one of the
following two tasks:

- name: Ensure node_config_directory directory exists for user kolla
  file:
    path: "{{ node_config_directory }}"
    state: directory
    recurse: true
    owner: "{{ kolla_user }}"
    group: "{{ kolla_group }}"
    mode: "0755"
  become: True
  when: create_kolla_user | bool

- name: Ensure node_config_directory directory exists
  file:
    path: "{{ node_config_directory }}"
    state: directory
    recurse: true
    mode: "0755"
  become: True
  when: not create_kolla_user | bool

On the first run, normally node_config_directory (/etc/kolla/) doesn't
exist, so it is created with kolla:kolla ownership and 0755 permissions.

If we then run 'kolla-ansible deploy', config files are created for
containers in this directory, e.g. /etc/kolla/nova-compute/. Permissions
for those files should be set according to 'config_owner_user' and
'config_owner_group'.

If at some point we again run kolla-ansible bootstrap-servers, it will
recursively set the ownership and permissions of all files in /etc/kolla
to kolla:kolla / 0755.

The solution is to change bootstrap-servers to not set the owner and
permissions recursively. It's also arguable that /etc/kolla should be
owned by 'config_owner_user' and 'config_owner_group', rather than
kolla:kolla, although that's a separate issue.

Change-Id: I24668914a9cedc94d5a6cb835648740ce9ce6e39
Closes-Bug: #1821599
(cherry picked from commit 6b0be5c5bacd91bb94ec6b75715affb9777e568d)
'}]
commit_message:
Remove recurse: yes for owner/perms on /etc/kolla

When kolla-ansible bootstrap-servers is run, it executes one of the
following two tasks:

- name: Ensure node_config_directory directory exists for user kolla
  file:
    path: "{{ node_config_directory }}"
    state: directory
    recurse: true
    owner: "{{ kolla_user }}"
    group: "{{ kolla_group }}"
    mode: "0755"
  become: True
  when: create_kolla_user | bool

- name: Ensure node_config_directory directory exists
  file:
    path: "{{ node_config_directory }}"
    state: directory
    recurse: true
    mode: "0755"
  become: True
  when: not create_kolla_user | bool

On the first run, normally node_config_directory (/etc/kolla/) doesn't
exist, so it is created with kolla:kolla ownership and 0755 permissions.

If we then run 'kolla-ansible deploy', config files are created for
containers in this directory, e.g. /etc/kolla/nova-compute/. Permissions
for those files should be set according to 'config_owner_user' and
'config_owner_group'.

If at some point we again run kolla-ansible bootstrap-servers, it will
recursively set the ownership and permissions of all files in /etc/kolla
to kolla:kolla / 0755.

The solution is to change bootstrap-servers to not set the owner and
permissions recursively. It's also arguable that /etc/kolla should be
owned by 'config_owner_user' and 'config_owner_group', rather than
kolla:kolla, although that's a separate issue.

Change-Id: I24668914a9cedc94d5a6cb835648740ce9ce6e39
Closes-Bug: #1821599
(cherry picked from commit 6b0be5c5bacd91bb94ec6b75715affb9777e568d)

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-04-01 21:31:32.000000000', 'message': '[Queens-only] Restart RabbitMQ and Erlang VM on major upgrade

When running a major upgrade, yum can upgrade to a newer major
version of Erlang, and it doesn't restart the running Erlang
Port Mapper Daemon (epmd).

When upgrading from Erlang 18 to Erlang 19, the Erlang VM
implements differently calls to OS commands [1]

This confuses RabbitMQ recurring monitoring process:

   ERROR: "Free disk space monitor encountered an error (e.g. failed to parse output from OS tools):

and also makes command line tools link management plugin fail
until epmd is restarted:

   $ rabbitmq-plugins list -E -m
   Error: invalid parameter: []

Since we already stop RabbitMQ before yum update, make sure to
also stop the running Erlang VM and let RabbitMQ restart it
automatically after the yum update.

We only do that for Queens because starting Rocky, RabbitMQ
is containerized and thus always restart both RabbitMQ and
Erlang VM on container image updates.

[1] https://github.com/erlang/otp/commit/200247f972b012ced0c4b2c6611f091af66ebedd

Closes-Bug: #1822120
Co-Authored-By: Peter Lemenkov <plemenko@redhat.com>

Change-Id: I52c2ae8bc53cd26ceae2ffa110c42dcb9392b99a
'}]
commit_message:
[Queens-only] Restart RabbitMQ and Erlang VM on major upgrade

When running a major upgrade, yum can upgrade to a newer major
version of Erlang, and it doesn't restart the running Erlang
Port Mapper Daemon (epmd).

When upgrading from Erlang 18 to Erlang 19, the Erlang VM
implements differently calls to OS commands [1]

This confuses RabbitMQ recurring monitoring process:

   ERROR: "Free disk space monitor encountered an error (e.g. failed to parse output from OS tools):

and also makes command line tools link management plugin fail
until epmd is restarted:

   $ rabbitmq-plugins list -E -m
   Error: invalid parameter: []

Since we already stop RabbitMQ before yum update, make sure to
also stop the running Erlang VM and let RabbitMQ restart it
automatically after the yum update.

We only do that for Queens because starting Rocky, RabbitMQ
is containerized and thus always restart both RabbitMQ and
Erlang VM on container image updates.

[1] https://github.com/erlang/otp/commit/200247f972b012ced0c4b2c6611f091af66ebedd

Closes-Bug: #1822120
Co-Authored-By: Peter Lemenkov <plemenko@redhat.com>

Change-Id: I52c2ae8bc53cd26ceae2ffa110c42dcb9392b99a

[{'created': '2019-03-29 06:09:26.000000000', 'message': 'Style corrections for privsep usage.

We always import privsep modules like this:

    import nova.privsep.libvirt

Not like this:

    from nova.privsep import libvirt

This is because it makes it obvious at the caller that a priviledged
operation is occuring:

    nova.privsep.libvirt.destroy_root_filesystem()

Not just:

    libvirt.destroy_root_filesystem()

This is especially true when the imported module is called "libvirt",
which is a very common term in the codebase and super hard to grep
for specific uses of.

I've corrected the existing style mismatches to make things consistent.

Change-Id: Ief177dbcb018da6fbad13bb0ff153fc47292d5b9

commit_message:
Style corrections for privsep usage.

We always import privsep modules like this:

    import nova.privsep.libvirt

Not like this:

    from nova.privsep import libvirt

This is because it makes it obvious at the caller that a priviledged
operation is occuring:

    nova.privsep.libvirt.destroy_root_filesystem()

Not just:

    libvirt.destroy_root_filesystem()

This is especially true when the imported module is called "libvirt",
which is a very common term in the codebase and super hard to grep
for specific uses of.

I've corrected the existing style mismatches to make things consistent.
Note that the next patch in this series covers this case with a
hacking check.

Change-Id: Ief177dbcb018da6fbad13bb0ff153fc47292d5b9

subject: Error location does not match Fields on copy form under container panel
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-04-04 03:25:09.000000000', 'message': 'Error location does not match Fields on copy form under container panel

On the copy form under container panel,
if the Destination Container does not exist and
the Destination Object is input, the Destination object
will be wrong, but no error message will be reported;
if the Destination container exists,
the Destination object will input an existing object,
which will cause the Destination container error

This bug is due to check-copy-destination
checking both containers and objects.

Change-Id: I8bc2e26835a0e690f94d8c0762807db599248d1b
Closes-Bug: #1823113
'}]
commit_message:
Error location does not match Fields on copy form under container panel

On the copy form under container panel,
if the Destination Container does not exist and
the Destination Object is input, the Destination object
will be wrong, but no error message will be reported;
if the Destination container exists,
the Destination object will input an existing object,
which will cause the Destination container error

This bug is due to check-copy-destination
checking both containers and objects.

Change-Id: I8bc2e26835a0e690f94d8c0762807db599248d1b
Closes-Bug: #1823113

commit_message:
Replace openstack.org git:// URLs with https://

This is a mechanically generated change to replace openstack.org
git:// URLs with https:// equivalents.

This is in aid of a planned future move of the git hosting
infrastructure to a self-hosted instance of gitea (https://gitea.io),
which does not support the git wire protocol at this stage.

This update should result in no functional change.

For more information see the thread at

 http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-March/003825.html

Change-Id: I2ffcaf9054ae032385c6338edcccc3030771a853

(3 comments)'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2018-09-05 11:13:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

The description of the workings of PUT /allocations is wrong (see within), so doing a -1 for that.

I've yet to form a full opinion of the general concept here. I agree with Jay that building in the functionality on the servers to allow an external tool to do the desired job/orchestration in a predictable way is a good thing, even if not all the pieces and parts are there yet for all the pieces."}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2018-09-05 12:19:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

(1 comment)

Chris, I'm not sure what else to say in support of having a consumers endpoint that matches the concept/object of a consumer itself.

Note we could have the `PUT /consumers/{consumer_id}` URI respond with the generation of the consumer (i.e. a representation of the consumer) and that would assuage your point about using the `PUT /allocations/{consumer_id}` endpoint because it "returns a representation of the consumer".

IMHO, it doesn't return a representation of the consumer. It returns a representation of the consumer's allocations. Which is a different thing.

-jay'}, {'account_id': 4690, 'date': '2018-09-05 15:31:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-09-06 17:58:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2018-09-07 18:26:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1

(9 comments)

Note that I'm kinda opposed to this because I think it shouldn't be necessary and is rather complicated to pull off. It goes against many of the things-should-be-ephemeral arguments Jay makes whilst grumbling about more commonplace things like BFV. So keep that in mind when reading my grumbles within :)"}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2018-09-07 18:28:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

You can grant access to an image and members have to accept it - so sort of like cinder's volume transfer API."}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-09-11 16:54:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

commit_message:
allow transferring ownership of instance

Adds functionality to placement and nova to allow transferring ownership
of an instance (a consumer in placement-land) from one project to
another (and one user to another). The proposal is for an admin-only
action, done via the REST API.

Change-Id: I08c7370dee330453136931f216d2b54bf4dadc23
blueprint: transfer-ownership

commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/stein

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/stein branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I272535f2597f770f0964d8b1ed75277f5a1b27df

commit_message:
Update master for stable/stein

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/stein.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/stein.

Change-Id: I8d2fbe902338856d4b84ea6328ec5a3702f26279
Sem-Ver: feature

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when

commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/stein

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/stein branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Ia37a48be3cdab90d7f0ad06990c81c7816ffbbe7

commit_message:
Update master for stable/stein

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/stein.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/stein.

Sem-Ver: feature

commit_message:
Fix AttributeError for tempest verifier

In case of missing admin credentials, rally is raising unexpected and
not userfriendly AttributeError. This patch is fixing this.

Change-Id: I5da96a7508f14626d0db9c7cbf817d66452af4ee

commit_message:
Added support for the rgw_swift_url parameter in the rgw.pp

This parameter is needed for the swift API if there is a load balancer
in front of the rados gateway servers. If not provided and the swift
access url is different than http://$::fqdn:port, the swift API is not
working (users get a connection error).

http://docs.ceph.com/docs/mimic/radosgw/config-ref/

Moreover, use the rgw_dns_name option both for civetweb and apache.
This is a valid option for both frontend types, and becomes necessary
if it has been changed at least once in the past.

Change-Id: I639d15e30b0ba6c94614c1650d4ea85258ae6ede

commit_message:
gate: drop sphinxmark

sphinxmark is currently broken due to Sphinx 2.0.0 release, this
patch drops all of the code which uses it for now until we land
an upstream fix that unbreaks us.

Change-Id: Iba0bc579b6a82046ca0a0d7177d2ba9fd95ac3a4
(cherry picked from commit 21ead443814d0270a212d9be8f7cf01dc7b27c7a)

commit_message:
Fix capabilities passed as string in agent prepare

The value of capabilities can be either a string or a dict.
There is a function to parse its value and provide a correct
output as expected and it should always be used when reading
node capabilities.

Change-Id: I789fffd5f67eddbe5058581f13d75320ca712897
Story: 2005280
Task: 30133
(cherry picked from commit 93a40e3fc7a8187c0444c1aae93a52beb5c68b4b)

commit_message:
Fix capabilities passed as string in agent prepare

The value of capabilities can be either a string or a dict.
There is a function to parse its value and provide a correct
output as expected and it should always be used when reading
node capabilities.

Change-Id: I789fffd5f67eddbe5058581f13d75320ca712897
Story: 2005280
Task: 30133
(cherry picked from commit 93a40e3fc7a8187c0444c1aae93a52beb5c68b4b)

commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/stein

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/stein branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Ifb24fde321815c60e2ac456695c2755da5175994

subject: Handle collections.abc deprecations
messages: [{'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2019-04-03 15:46:22.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2019-04-03 15:50:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1\n\nNinja-approving a test harness change.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-04-03 15:46:22.000000000', 'message': "Handle collections.abc deprecations

The use of ABC classes directly from collections has been deprecated in
3.x versions of Python. The direction is to use the classes defined in
collections.abc. Python 2.7 does not have this, but Python 3.8 will be
dropping the backwards compatibility to use the old location.

Six also does not have support for this yet, so in the mean time to make
sure we don't run into issues as folks try to move to 3.8, and to get
rid of deprecation warnings in logs, this handles importing from the
preferred location and falls back if it not available.

Change-Id: I11e482354725ed74629dcaa9f2b7f229a60aa2a8
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Handle collections.abc deprecations

The use of ABC classes directly from collections has been deprecated in
3.x versions of Python. The direction is to use the classes defined in
collections.abc. Python 2.7 does not have this, but Python 3.8 will be
dropping the backwards compatibility to use the old location.

Six also does not have support for this yet, so in the mean time to make
sure we don't run into issues as folks try to move to 3.8, and to get
rid of deprecation warnings in logs, this handles importing from the
preferred location and falls back if it not available.

Change-Id: I11e482354725ed74629dcaa9f2b7f229a60aa2a8
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

Replace context.tenant with context.project_id
to fix the following warning.

  DeprecationWarning: Property 'tenant' has moved to 'project_id'
  in version '2.6' and will be removed in version '3.0'

commit_message:
Fix a deprecation warning

Replace context.tenant with context.project_id
to fix the following warning.

  DeprecationWarning: Property 'tenant' has moved to 'project_id'
  in version '2.6' and will be removed in version '3.0'

Change-Id: I7ae02d7f25486ee7a424c96e6c61b66461a01f09
Closes-Bug: #1822729

Glance tests are currently too verbose for subunit and make
them randomly fail under python 3.

Using raw strings should avoid the DeprecationWarnings around

commit_message:
Quiece 'invalid escape sequence' deprecation msg

Glance tests are currently too verbose for subunit and make
them randomly fail under python 3.

Using raw strings should avoid the DeprecationWarnings around
'invalid escape sequence' being used with the re module.

Change-Id: I14c381ac4b17ca4c5755ed78c55dc44362ab37ef

[{'created': '2019-04-03 13:12:07.000000000', 'message': "Clarify policy_file configuration option help text

This options help text was ambiguous and didn't really give readers
a good idea of what policies were or if the path could be relative,
absolute, or both.

This commit attempts to clarify the help text a little bit so that
readers have a little more to go on.

commit_message:
Clarify policy_file configuration option help text

This options help text was ambiguous and didn't really give readers
a good idea of what policies were or if the path could be relative,
absolute, or both.

This commit attempts to clarify the help text a little bit so that
readers have a little more to go on.

Change-Id: Icda67f07f0ef5ee256113634d29f4662b48140cc

messages:
[{'account_id': 16708, 'date': '2019-03-27 22:31:33.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 16708, 'date': '2019-03-28 02:38:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Published edit on patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 8213, 'date': '2019-03-29 17:03:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

There already is a 0.1.0 release made last year: https://github.com/openstack/oswin-tempest-plugin/releases/tag/0.1.0

So, the version should be bumped.'}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2019-04-01 02:42:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> There already is a 0.1.0 release made last year: https://github.com/openstack/oswin-tempest-plugin/releases/tag/0.1.0
 > 
 > So, the version should be bumped.

 > There already is a 0.1.0 release made last year: https://github.com/openstack/oswin-tempest-plugin/releases/tag/0.1.0
 > 
 > So, the version should be bumped.

Oh?

 ###
 [tony@thor releases]$ ls deliverables/*/oswin*temp*
 deliverables/_independent/oswin-tempest-plugin.yaml
 deliverables/rocky/oswin-tempest-plugin.yaml
 deliverables/stein/oswin-tempest-plugin.yaml
 [tony@thor releases]$ cat deliverables/_independent/oswin-tempest-plugin.yaml
 ---
 include-pypi-link: yes
 launchpad: oswin-tempest-plugin
 team: winstackers
 type: other
 repository-settings:
   openstack/oswin-tempest-plugin: {}
 releases:
   - version: 0.1.0
     projects:
       - repo: openstack/oswin-tempest-plugin
         hash: e1ebf080016dd452841936186fcee58b617ce0ea
 [tony@thor releases]$ 
 ###

I guess we can decide if that needs fixing later, and for now just release 0.2.0'}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2019-04-01 02:43:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Published edit on patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 8213, 'date': '2019-04-01 09:35:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2019-04-01 09:39:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2019-04-02 23:25:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2019-04-03 21:18:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

commit_message:
gate: drop sphinxmark

sphinxmark is currently broken due to Sphinx 2.0.0 release, this
patch drops all of the code which uses it for now until we land
an upstream fix that unbreaks us.

Change-Id: Iba0bc579b6a82046ca0a0d7177d2ba9fd95ac3a4

commit_message:
Fix the way to get localhost IP in devstack

In Ubuntu Bionic, the following command returns "uid" so that the
guest-agent service will fail because of invalid IP address.

$ ip route get 8.8.8.8 | head -1 | cut -d' ' -f8
uid
$ ip route get 8.8.8.8 | head -1
8.8.8.8 via 10.0.17.1 dev ens3 src 10.0.17.131 uid 0

In Ubuntu Xenial:

$ ip route get 8.8.8.8 | head -1 | cut -d' ' -f8
10.0.17.132
$ ip route get 8.8.8.8 | head -1
8.8.8.8 via 192.168.192.1 dev eth0  src 10.0.17.132

Change-Id: Iae24686fa65603b7d22b09da99b7590e4e117454

commit_message:
Only allow IP access type for CephFS NFS

For the CephFS NFS back end only ``IP`` access type
is valid so enforce this in the driver.

Also validate access level since there is a utility
routine to check both access type and access level.

Closes-bug: #1816420
Change-Id: I6c96f861b30ef7ccac05a7c199a62f0d69044c3a
(cherry picked from commit 9df750fd19c6c11562b7bf86464185cd63568310)

messages: [{'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2019-04-03 15:11:30.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2019-04-03 15:30:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2019-04-03 15:35:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2019-04-03 17:36:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:\n\nrecheck'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-04-03 15:11:30.000000000', 'message': "Handle collections.abc deprecations

The use of ABC classes directly from collections has been deprecated in
3.x versions of Python. The direction is to use the classes defined in
collections.abc. Python 2.7 does not have this, but Python 3.8 will be
dropping the backwards compatibility to use the old location.

Six also does not have support for this yet, so in the mean time to make
sure we don't run into issues as folks try to move to 3.8, and to get
rid of deprecation warnings in logs, this handles importing from the
preferred location and falls back if it not available.

Change-Id: I535640779da645e43ba6586308b07bf25dba7d89
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Handle collections.abc deprecations

The use of ABC classes directly from collections has been deprecated in
3.x versions of Python. The direction is to use the classes defined in
collections.abc. Python 2.7 does not have this, but Python 3.8 will be
dropping the backwards compatibility to use the old location.

Six also does not have support for this yet, so in the mean time to make
sure we don't run into issues as folks try to move to 3.8, and to get
rid of deprecation warnings in logs, this handles importing from the
preferred location and falls back if it not available.

Change-Id: I535640779da645e43ba6586308b07bf25dba7d89
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Fix generating connections to OVN db

Correct way how we generate ovn db connection
and recognize when ovn_host is IPV4 or IPV6

Change-Id: Iaed7304adf40a87a0f14b7a95339f8416140e947
Closes-Bug: #1822546
(cherry picked from commit 1514e983babfba29836bf7582023fd1ad3be3a62)

commit_message:
Added instance actions for conductor

to track result of conductor actions
wrap_instance_event decorator is moved to
compute_utils and is added to migrate_server
method on conductor.manager

bp: async-live-migration-rest-check

Change-Id: I01e6ba9c9d8df8690d2cecea2cc48e45cf7a53c4

subject: Release requirements for stein rc1
messages:
[{'account_id': 16708, 'date': '2019-03-27 22:31:48.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2019-03-28 02:23:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Published edit on patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2019-03-28 02:24:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

/me dons requirements hat

Doing this certainly doesn't hurt and may be a good thing but it isn't typical"}, {'account_id': 14288, 'date': '2019-03-28 20:31:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

doesn't hurt like you said, we've done this in the past and I generally try to do one release per cycle just in case, so wfm"}, {'account_id': 14288, 'date': '2019-03-28 20:33:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

we might want to bump to af41b096a5a0852a15c3989ec48b956433c47873 but since this is more releasing the tooling it may not mater (uc bump because upstream removed releases of croniter)'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2019-04-01 09:49:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> we might want to bump to af41b096a5a0852a15c3989ec48b956433c47873
 > but since this is more releasing the tooling it may not mater (uc
 > bump because upstream removed releases of croniter)

We are in need of consistency, so I suppose they were all generated together at a single point by Kendall. Although I understand why you would not want to release with a bad croniter.

I would then update the SHA to the closest one of Kendall's date, with the croniter's bump. Any other opinions?"}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2019-04-03 21:02:25.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Not needed.'}]

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-03-24 20:44:53.000000000', 'message': 'Replace openstack.org git:// URLs with https://

This is a mechanically generated change to replace openstack.org
git:// URLs with https:// equivalents.

This is in aid of a planned future move of the git hosting
infrastructure to a self-hosted instance of gitea (https://gitea.io),
which does not support the git wire protocol at this stage.

This update should result in no functional change.

For more information see the thread at

 http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-March/003825.html

Change-Id: Ie1e19ff80f313a92536e1f2fd656f02135b5f670
'}]
commit_message:
Replace openstack.org git:// URLs with https://

This is a mechanically generated change to replace openstack.org
git:// URLs with https:// equivalents.

This is in aid of a planned future move of the git hosting
infrastructure to a self-hosted instance of gitea (https://gitea.io),
which does not support the git wire protocol at this stage.

This update should result in no functional change.

For more information see the thread at

 http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-March/003825.html

Change-Id: Ie1e19ff80f313a92536e1f2fd656f02135b5f670

subject: Use labels to mount filesystems in the guide
messages: [{'account_id': 597, 'date': '2019-04-03 03:50:18.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2019-04-03 17:29:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1\n\nlgtm'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-04-03 03:50:18.000000000', 'message': "Use labels to mount filesystems in the guide

It was a recommended practice for years to get away from straight
names in /dev, like /dev/sda1, when mounting filesystems. The
man page for mount(8) says:

   The device name of disk partitions are unstable; hardware
   reconfiguration, adding or removing a device can cause change
   in names. This is reason why it's strongly recommended to use
   filesystem or partition identificators like UUID or LABEL.

Nonetheless, novice operators sometimes follow our deployment
guide to the letter and then get into trouble when device names
shift from under their deployments. This patch fixes the problem
without bloating up the guide with general explanations.

Change-Id: I5faae158b62e0395d6e774cd67bd868c785c2186
"}]
commit_message:
Use labels to mount filesystems in the guide

It was a recommended practice for years to get away from straight
names in /dev, like /dev/sda1, when mounting filesystems. The
man page for mount(8) says:

   The device name of disk partitions are unstable; hardware
   reconfiguration, adding or removing a device can cause change
   in names. This is reason why it's strongly recommended to use
   filesystem or partition identificators like UUID or LABEL.

Nonetheless, novice operators sometimes follow our deployment
guide to the letter and then get into trouble when device names
shift from under their deployments. This patch fixes the problem
without bloating up the guide with general explanations.

Change-Id: I5faae158b62e0395d6e774cd67bd868c785c2186

commit_message:
Add doc on VGPU allocs and inventories for nrp

Now that we reshape inventories and allocations for VGPU resources in Stein,
we think it's good for operators to know how to verify the resources using
osc-placement.

Change-Id: Ic58709aac2dd1f20f1b8440a3cea4f29eed9a965
Closes-Bug: #1821015
(cherry picked from commit 44490142be5c20389703aeed54edca28f27c43c0)

subject: Refactor aggregate _get_trees_matching_all()
messages:
[{'account_id': 25625, 'date': '2019-03-28 10:01:57.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 25625, 'date': '2019-03-28 10:11:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Note: We could re-use get_provider_ids_for_traits_and_aggs() *if* we didn't have the constraints that "the rule 'aggregate on root spans the whole tree' doesn't apply on member_ofN function". Actually gibi has addressed that this is weird in [1]. It is good to have a discussion for this.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/603352/5/specs/stein/approved/negative-aggregate-membership.rst@137'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-03-28 15:29:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Well, I'm pretty baffled by this. I can see that the issue is fixed, but I don't understand how moving the member_of logic into the loop makes that happen.

Also, does this allow us to remove whatever post-filtering was making the results right?

pep8 failures are real."}, {'account_id': 25625, 'date': '2019-03-29 05:20:43.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 25625, 'date': '2019-03-29 07:49:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> Well, I'm pretty baffled by this. I can see that the issue is fixed, but I don't understand how moving the member_of logic into the loop makes that happen.

* An orphan (having enough resource whose family doesn’t have enough resource) is filtered out in provs_with_inv.merge_common_trees(provs_with_inv_rc)

* In other words, filtering out RPs after provs_with_inv.merge_common_trees(provs_with_inv_rc) produces orphans.

> Also, does this allow us to remove whatever post-filtering was making the results right?

* Not really so far because we don’t have post filtering for aggregates.

* …If we do the same thing for forbidden traits, we could remove forbidden traits check from _get_trees_with_traits() and from check_traits_for_alloc_request(). If we want to do that, I’d like to re-use get_provider_ids_for_traits_and_aggs(). But we can’t reuse it. I mean we can’t mix forbidden aggregate rps and forbidden trait rps because of the aggregate spans policy. What’s irritating here is that we have different policies for the two paths of _alloc_candidates_multiple_providers()  and _alloc_candidates_single_provider() for aggregate span policy. If we decide that “aggregate on root *always* spans whole tree even in granular requests“, we can do put that aggregate-on-root check in SQL layer in provider_ids_matching_aggregates(), which enables mixing forbidden aggregate rps and forbidden trait rps, which I think cleaner and easier to understand. I know this is code based speaking/discussion and we shouldn’t design policies on code matter. Real use-case matters. However, consider a case where only granular requests are used. (e.g. root has no resource and two children have resources but we want them from separately because of their traits or something like we need VCPUs from two NUMA nodes case). In this case, if operator puts aggregate A on root, aggregate A doesn’t apply to the NUMA rps because the placement caller uses only granular requests. Don’t you think this is an issue? This is why I had a note in PS1. At least it is good to have a discussion on this."}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-03-29 13:38:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2

> filtering out RPs after provs_with_inv.merge_common_trees(provs_with_inv_rc) produces orphans.

Ah, thank you for that explanation, that makes sense.

The issue you raise in PS1 sounds like something we should address later, right? It would be a change in behavior that's already "out there" so it doesn't make sense to try to fix it in this patch?'}, {'account_id': 5754, 'date': '2019-04-02 13:49:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

okay, I guess I need a clear mind to review...not today...'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2019-04-03 14:21:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

Looks like there is more we could do here, but there's always more.

Tetsuro, if you have some ideas on where we need to clarify how "spanning" works, can you make sure they show up on the ptg etherpad: https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/placement-ptg-train . Ah, looks like you already did. Excellent.'}]

This patch refactors _get_trees_matching_all() not to

Change-Id: I4d23ecdca67ca0864b24e25902df53c64e7329a7

Refactor aggregate _get_trees_matching_all()

This patch refactors _get_trees_matching_all() not to
return orphaned resource provider due to aggregate filter.

Change-Id: I4d23ecdca67ca0864b24e25902df53c64e7329a7

commit_message:
Refactor ResourceProviderListTestCase

Some tests in ResourceProviderListTestCase validated the number of
resource providers returned by p_obj.get_all_by_filters(), but didn't
validate if they are proper resource providers.

This patch adds that check adding a small test helper function,
_run_get_all_by_filters().

Change-Id: Id642d89c854744cbc2d36519004c87e9f2546269

This is splendid, some grammar nits within, and Takashi's comments are right.

I don't think I saw a gabbi test for:

    We do NOT support ``!`` in the ``in:`` prefix,

      ``&member_of=in:<agg1>,<agg2>,!<agg3>``

Also normalize_member_of_qs_params is might warrant some unit tests now that it is getting rather complex both in terms of the inputs it might get and the outputs it produces. Most of those inputs are covered by the gabbi tests, but not all.

This patch adds microversion 1.32 supporting the forbidden aggregate
expression within existing ``member_of`` queryparam both in
``GET /resource_providers`` and in ``GET /allocation_candidates``.
Forbidden aggregates are prefixed with a ``!``.

commit_message:
Negative member_of query with microversion 1.32

This patch adds microversion 1.32 supporting the forbidden aggregate
expression within existing ``member_of`` queryparam both in
``GET /resource_providers`` and in ``GET /allocation_candidates``.
Forbidden aggregates are prefixed with a ``!``.

We do NOT support ``!`` within the ``in:`` list:

  ?member_of=in:<agg1>,<agg2>,!<agg3>

but we support ``!in:`` prefix:

  ?member_of=!in:<agg1>,<agg2>,<agg3>

which is equivalent to:

  ?member_of=!<agg1>&member_of=!<agg2>&member_of=!<agg3>

where candidate resource providers must not be in agg1, agg2, or agg3.

Change-Id: Ibba7981744c71ab5d4d0ee5d5a40709c6a5c6b5e
Story: 2005297
Task: 30183

commit_message:
release a 1.0.0.0rc3 of placement

This version corrects an error in a logging debug message and
includes useful documentation for a feature that is present in
Stein.

$ git log  --oneline --no-merges 1.0.0.0rc2..b4ac3f7fa0396cd3e67ad6c127ebf5ef575581b3
6722d066 Document alloc-candidates-in-tree
b4492bcc Fix debug log getting allocation_candidates

Change-Id: Ife29df28e4ae572d4fd0433b1de1989191c72739

commit_message:
Add whitebox-tempest-plugin project

Whitebox-tempest-plugin is for testing things that are outside of
Tempest's scope - namely, anything not exposed through the REST APIs.
It is currently being used mainly for Nova whitebox testing, checking
things like configuration settings and libvirt instance XML.

Change-Id: I973995bbbd29d179b0271f2c15d05782d9033f3d

[{'created': '2019-03-24 20:48:13.000000000', 'message': 'Replace openstack.org git:// URLs with https://

This is a mechanically generated change to replace openstack.org
git:// URLs with https:// equivalents.

This is in aid of a planned future move of the git hosting
infrastructure to a self-hosted instance of gitea (https://gitea.io),
which does not support the git wire protocol at this stage.

This update should result in no functional change.

For more information see the thread at

 http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-March/003825.html

Change-Id: If416ba6fe80127f230cffed064da5837d021be80
'}]
commit_message:
Replace openstack.org git:// URLs with https://

This is a mechanically generated change to replace openstack.org
git:// URLs with https:// equivalents.

This is in aid of a planned future move of the git hosting
infrastructure to a self-hosted instance of gitea (https://gitea.io),
which does not support the git wire protocol at this stage.

This update should result in no functional change.

For more information see the thread at

 http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-March/003825.html

Change-Id: If416ba6fe80127f230cffed064da5837d021be80

commit_message:
Prepare for negative member queryparam 2

This patch prepares for supporting negative member_of queryparam
in DB layer changing the following function:

get_trees_matching_all():
    - used in GET /allocation_candidates for the case where the
      granular request is not specified and sharing provider or
      nested provider exists.

Change-Id: Iafa51cca86eb5a4b480c8296e2ee059ae2b69948
Story: 2005297
Task: 30183

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-03-28 09:16:02.000000000', 'message': "Remove and rearrange object bonged proxy tests

There are two test classes witha  setUp method and all of their
tests commented out. The commented tests pre-date the merge and
are implemented using httpretty, which is not what we use around
here. The fun part is though, since they subclass the proxy tests,
they are not adding any value - BUT cause the proxy tests to run
multiple times. Just remove them, since they're wasting energy.

Also, there are a couple of tests in their own classes, which is
similarly not the right design, as it causes all of the tests in
the parent class to be run again. Move them into the main class.

Change-Id: Ie328a3cd6e59cb9f40a57cd2c79bbd5890e1f2fe

commit_message:
Remove and rearrange object bonged proxy tests

There are two test classes witha  setUp method and all of their
tests commented out. The commented tests pre-date the merge and
are implemented using httpretty, which is not what we use around
here. The fun part is though, since they subclass the proxy tests,
they are not adding any value - BUT cause the proxy tests to run
multiple times. Just remove them, since they're wasting energy.

Also, there are a couple of tests in their own classes, which is
similarly not the right design, as it causes all of the tests in
the parent class to be run again. Move them into the main class.

Change-Id: Ie328a3cd6e59cb9f40a57cd2c79bbd5890e1f2fe

commit_message:
Move set_temp_url_key logic into resource objects

These are resource-specific methods, so they should exist on the
Resource objects. Move the methods there and make the proxy methods
use them. Also, shift tests for them into the object_store tests.
This puts them more where they should be - and puts requests_mock
tests into those files, which is a good example for people.

While we're in there, stop creating a Proxy with a Session and use
the object_store Proxy that exists.

Change-Id: I4ba4456ff044c6c2b0c4ab5faeaf3e3cfd77194f

commit_message:

* Taken out of context, the note could cause a bit of confusion,
  explicitly note the difference between flat and neutron networking.

Change-Id: Ief0cf6861b510af50574fdf623526a1560301caf
Signed-off-by: Jan Gutter <jan.gutter@netronome.com>

subject: Migrate rally-database-migration to Ubuntu Bionic
messages: [{'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2019-04-03 18:05:31.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2019-04-03 18:46:55.000000000', 'content': 'Topic set to legacy-job-bionic'}, {'account_id': 9545, 'date': '2019-04-03 19:13:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-04-03 18:05:31.000000000', 'message': 'Migrate rally-database-migration to Ubuntu Bionic

We have migrated the zuulv3 job to Bionic during Dec/Jan month.
 - http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2018-December/000837.html
 - https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/devstack-bionic
But that effort does not move all gate job to Bionic as there are
large amount of jobs are still legacy jobs. All the legacy jobs still
use Xenial as nodeset.

As per the decided runtime for Stein, we need to test everything on openstack
CI/CD on Bionic - https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/stein.html

This commit mofiy the rally-database-migration job to run on
bionic.

More Details:
- https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/legacy-job-bionic
- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-March/003614.html

Change-Id: Idab37e177430fde3bd6e3a790fe1f15aec06200c
'}]
commit_message:
Migrate rally-database-migration to Ubuntu Bionic

We have migrated the zuulv3 job to Bionic during Dec/Jan month.
 - http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2018-December/000837.html
 - https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/devstack-bionic
But that effort does not move all gate job to Bionic as there are
large amount of jobs are still legacy jobs. All the legacy jobs still
use Xenial as nodeset.

As per the decided runtime for Stein, we need to test everything on openstack
CI/CD on Bionic - https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/stein.html

This commit mofiy the rally-database-migration job to run on
bionic.

More Details:
- https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/legacy-job-bionic
- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-March/003614.html

Change-Id: Idab37e177430fde3bd6e3a790fe1f15aec06200c

commit_message:
Force C.UTF-8 when dealing with rabbitmq

When we use rabbitmq 3.7 we might hit the following issue when running rabbitmqctl commands inside containers (as puppet does):

  Error: Failed to apply catalog: Cannot parse invalid user line: warning:
  the VM is running with native name encoding of latin1 which may cause
  Elixir to malfunction as it expects utf8. Please ensure your locale is
  set to UTF-8 (which can be verified by running "locale" in your shell)

This is fundamentally the tripleo version of
https://github.com/voxpupuli/puppet-rabbitmq/issues/671

This is a strict requirement coming from Elixir:
https://github.com/elixir-lang/elixir/issues/3548

Since containers do not have UTF-8 as a default we have this problem:
[root@overcloud-controller-0 ~]# podman exec -it rabbitmq-bundle-podman-0 sh
()[root@overcloud-controller-0 /]$ rabbitmqctl -q list_users
warning: the VM is running with native name encoding of latin1 which may cause Elixir to malfunction as it expects utf8. Please ensure your locale is set to UTF-8 (which can be verified by ru nning "locale" in your shell) user tags
guest [administrator]
()[root@overcloud-controller-0 /]$ locale
LANG=
LC_CTYPE="POSIX"
LC_NUMERIC="POSIX"
LC_TIME="POSIX"
LC_COLLATE="POSIX"
LC_MONETARY="POSIX"
LC_MESSAGES="POSIX"
LC_PAPER="POSIX"
LC_NAME="POSIX"
LC_ADDRESS="POSIX"
LC_TELEPHONE="POSIX"
LC_MEASUREMENT="POSIX"
LC_IDENTIFICATION="POSIX"
LC_ALL=

This is the THT version of forcing UTF-8 on all rabbitmq_init_bundles
and on epmd itself. The puppet-tripleo one is the depends-on:
Depends-on: I21ef2e7862f3e5e21812d342b1681f8d5f7f005d

Tested on the original environment from Emilien where we saw this issue
during scale-up. After appling this review and its dependency we
correctly got a scaleup with rabbitm3.7 working

Closes-Bug: #1822673
Co-Authored-By: Damien Ciabrini <dciabrin@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Ifc1377811de68bf14ea4aea4dfb52e22a8864d46

commit_message:
Replace openstack.org git:// URLs with https://

This is a mechanically generated change to replace openstack.org
git:// URLs with https:// equivalents.

This is in aid of a planned future move of the git hosting
infrastructure to a self-hosted instance of gitea (https://gitea.io),
which does not support the git wire protocol at this stage.

This update should result in no functional change.

For more information see the thread at

 http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-March/003825.html

Change-Id: Id77ad092d3117d38bcacfb9dcb7a0b921145d4cc

commit_message:
Fix misuse of assertTrue

The first argument of assertTrue should not be True,
otherwise the assertTrue will be useless and always pass.

Change-Id: I20ef33b1406f475c443f4ac41cd449a3d7770829

commit_message:
Fix VIP plugging on CentOS-based amphorae

ifup does not provide option -v in CentOS-based amphorae.
This option was added in I0dbb145ab9a0bb8f831c1db28cabd262f9394e7e.

Story: 2005341
Task: 30288

Change-Id: I56947e0d2bb207b59b0b3928efc96546d6410f43
(cherry picked from commit 95a872fcd905c0f7c4f2b4cf63e93fa9770d13c1)
